name: Peroni Lager
serverNotes: Crisp, refreshing Italian lager from Birra Peroni, founded 1846 in Rome. 5.1% ABV, 24 IBU. Clean, light Pilsner-style malt flavor with delicate hop character. Easy-drinking with low bitterness and subtle corn sweetness. Brewed with Italian maize for crisp finish. Italy's #1 beer and most iconic brand—served in every trattoria from Milan to Sicily. Perfect aperitif before meals (Italian beer culture) or with pizza margherita, pasta aglio e olio, prosciutto, and lighter Italian dishes. Serve ice cold (38-40°F) in a chilled glass. Authentic Italian dining experience—this is what Italians drink. The blue label is recognized worldwide. Pairs wonderfully with mozzarella, caprese salad, seafood pasta, and wood-fired pizza. Gateway to Italian beer culture.

name: Jack's Abby Copper Legend, Oktoberfest Lager
serverNotes: Traditional Oktoberfest-style Märzen lager from Jack's Abby Craft Lagers in Framingham, MA (founded 2011). 5.7% ABV, 25 IBU. Rich toasted malt character with caramel, bread crust, and biscuit notes. Smooth, medium-bodied with subtle noble hop balance. Authentic German-style brewing using lager yeast and traditional decoction mashing. Brewed in spring, traditionally lagered until fall—Jack's Abby honors this tradition. Perfect with bratwurst, pork schnitzel, roasted chicken, pretzels, and hearty German-inspired dishes. Serve cold (45-50°F) in a stein or Märzen glass. Seasonal fall favorite that captures Munich's Oktoberfest spirit. Local Massachusetts craft excellence. Pairs wonderfully with apple dishes, roasted root vegetables, and caramelized onions. This is autumn in a glass.

name: "Pulp Daddy" Imperial IPA by Greater Good
serverNotes: Bold Imperial IPA (Double IPA) from Greater Good Brewing in Worcester, MA. 8% ABV, 80+ IBU. Intense hop character with layers of citrus, mango, pineapple, and tropical fruit. Higher alcohol creates warmth and full body. Generously dry-hopped for maximum aroma. Bitter but balanced finish. Local Worcester brewery supporting the community. For serious IPA lovers ready for hop intensity or pair with spicy buffalo wings, jalapeño burgers, Korean BBQ, and strong flavors that can stand up to the hops. 13 oz pour (not a full pint due to higher ABV). Serve cold (40-45°F). The name 'Pulp Daddy' references the hazy, juicy character. Pairs excellently with aged cheddar, spicy Thai, and IPA cheddar soup. This is hop heaven.

name: "Lunch Car" by Double Down
description: West Coast IPA, Worcester, MA, 6.5% ABV
serverNotes: Classic West Coast IPA from Double Down Brewing in Worcester, MA. 6.5% ABV, 65 IBU. Traditional West Coast style with assertive pine resin, ruby red grapefruit, and citrus zest hops. Crisp, clean, dry finish—not hazy like New England IPAs. Lighter body lets hop character shine. Celebrates the original IPA style from California with aggressive bitterness and clear appearance. Local Worcester craft beer supporting the community. Pairs excellently with bacon cheeseburgers, crispy fried chicken, pepperoni pizza, and buffalo wings. The bitterness cuts through fat beautifully. Serve cold (40-45°F) in an IPA glass. Hoppy but balanced—great for traditional IPA fans who want clarity and bite. The name references Worcester's lunch car diner culture. West Coast pride in Central Mass.

name: Allagash White Wheat Ale
serverNotes: Belgian-style witbier (white beer) from Allagash Brewing in Portland, ME (founded 1995). 5.2% ABV, 20 IBU. Brewed with wheat, oats, orange peel, and coriander spice. Cloudy, unfiltered appearance with light, refreshing body. Citrusy with subtle spice notes and creamy wheat texture. Award-winning—one of America's finest Belgian-style beers. Perfect with steamed mussels, lobster rolls, Caesar salad, goat cheese, and lighter fare. Serve cold (40-45°F) in a tulip glass. Great summer beer that appeals to wine drinkers and beer lovers alike. Pairs wonderfully with lemon dishes, fresh herbs, and grilled fish. This is Maine brewing excellence. Belgian tradition meets New England craft.

name: Carlson "Oak Hill" Hard Cider
serverNotes: Crisp, dry hard cider from local Massachusetts apples. Naturally gluten-free. Refreshing, not too sweet. Great beer alternative for gluten-free guests. Pairs with pork, chicken, salads. Local craft cider.

name: Wachusett Blueberry Ale
serverNotes: Blueberry ale from Wachusett Brewing in Westminster, MA (founded 1994). 4.5% ABV, 18 IBU. Subtle blueberry aroma and flavor over a light, crisp golden ale base. Made with real blueberries—not extract or artificial flavoring. Refreshing and easy-drinking with gentle fruit character that doesn't overwhelm. Local Massachusetts brewery named after Mount Wachusett. Great for guests who want a fruit-forward beer without heavy bitterness or hops. Pairs excellently with summer salads, grilled chicken, lemon desserts, and blueberry pancakes. Serve cold (38-42°F). Appeals to cider drinkers and those new to craft beer. This is approachable New England fruit beer done right. Blueberry harvest in every sip.

name: "Be Hoppy" by Wormtown IPA
serverNotes: Hoppy American IPA from Wormtown Brewery in Worcester, MA (founded 2010). 6.5% ABV, 70 IBU. Citrus-forward with grapefruit, tropical fruit, and pine resin hops. Bitter, aromatic finish with golden color. Community favorite—Wormtown is deeply rooted in Worcester culture. The playful name 'Be Hoppy' reflects Worcester's upbeat attitude. Great with bacon burgers, buffalo wings, fried pickles, and bold flavors. Serve cold (40-45°F). For hop lovers who support local craft beer and Worcester pride. Pairs excellently with spicy foods, aged cheddar, and IPA braised dishes. Local brewery, local hops, local love. Worcester's hoppy handshake.

name: Surfside Iced Tea & Vodka
serverNotes: Hard iced tea made with vodka and real tea flavor. Lightly sweet, refreshing, and easy-drinking. Great alternative to beer for guests who prefer cocktails in a can or lighter options.

name: Switchback Ale
serverNotes: Smooth, unfiltered amber ale from Switchback Brewing in Burlington, VT (founded 2002). 5% ABV, 22 IBU. Malty, slightly sweet with toffee and caramel notes. Subtle hop balance with smooth finish. Unfiltered for fuller body and flavor. Easy-drinking and approachable—Vermont's most popular craft beer for good reason. The flagship that built Switchback's reputation. Pairs with everything: burgers, pepperoni pizza, rotisserie chicken, and bar snacks. Serve cold (42-45°F). Crowd-pleaser that converts macro lager drinkers to craft. Pairs excellently with Vermont cheddar, maple-glazed pork, and comfort food. This is what Vermonters drink after skiing. Green Mountain sessionability.

name: Fiddlehead IPA
serverNotes: Bright, citrus-forward IPA from Fiddlehead Brewing in Shelburne, VT (founded 2011). 6.2% ABV, 60 IBU. Juicy with ruby red grapefruit, orange peel, and tropical mango notes. Clean finish with moderate bitterness—not hazy but aromatic. East Coast IPA style that bridges West Coast clarity with New England juiciness. Flavorful but balanced—sessionable hop character. Great with grilled shrimp, Caesar salad, lemon chicken, and citrus vinaigrettes. Serve cold (40-45°F). One of Vermont's most sought-after IPAs. Pairs excellently with goat cheese, Thai basil, and hop-friendly dishes. This is Vermont IPA done right—bright, clean, delicious. Fiddlehead ferns meet hop cones.

name: High Noon Pineapple Vodka Soda
serverNotes: Light, refreshing vodka soda with real pineapple juice. Low calorie, gluten-free, no added sugar. 4.5% ABV. Tropical, not too sweet. Popular hard seltzer alternative. Great for poolside, warm weather, or lighter drinking option.

name: High Noon Peach Vodka Soda
serverNotes: Light vodka soda with real peach juice. Low calorie, gluten-free, no added sugar. 4.5% ABV. Sweet but refreshing peach flavor. Great summer drink or lighter alternative. Appeals to guests who want lower ABV, fewer calories.

name: High Noon Watermelon Vodka Soda
serverNotes: Light vodka soda with real watermelon juice. Low calorie, gluten-free, no added sugar. 4.5% ABV. Fresh, summery watermelon taste. Perfect warm weather drink or light option. Good alternative to beer or heavy cocktails.

name: Allagash, Curieux, Barrel Aged Tripel
serverNotes: Belgian Tripel aged in Jim Beam bourbon barrels from Allagash Brewing, Portland, ME. 10.2% ABV, 28 IBU. Complex with vanilla, coconut, oak, caramel, and warm spice from barrel aging. High ABV creates rich, warming character. The Tripel base (Belgian style) meets American bourbon barrels—best of both worlds. Award-winning—multiple medals from GABF and World Beer Cup. For beer connoisseurs and special occasions only. This is a sipping beer like fine whiskey. Serve at cellar temperature (50-55°F) in a snifter. Pairs exquisitely with crème brûlée, aged Gouda, vanilla ice cream, and bourbon barrel-aged anything. Rich enough for dessert pairing. This is Maine barrel-aging mastery. Belgian tradition, American barrels, Portland excellence.

name: Peroni, Lager
serverNotes: Non-alcoholic version of Italy's favorite lager from Birra Peroni. 0.0% ABV, 12 IBU. Crisp, clean, refreshing taste that closely mimics the original Peroni. Made using de-alcoholization process that preserves authentic beer flavor. Great for designated drivers, pregnant guests, health-conscious diners, or anyone avoiding alcohol while still wanting the beer experience. Pairs with all Italian dishes: pizza, pasta, antipasti, and seafood. Serve ice cold (38-40°F). The blue label you know, minus the alcohol. Authentic Italian lager flavor without compromise. NA done right by Italian masters.

name: Heineken "0.0" Lager
serverNotes: Zero alcohol Heineken (0.0% ABV) with authentic Dutch lager taste. Crisp, slightly fruity with subtle malt sweetness and balanced hop character. Premium non-alcoholic option using Heineken's proprietary brewing and de-alcoholization process. Tastes remarkably like regular Heineken. For guests who want full beer experience without alcohol: athletes, designated drivers, lunch meetings, health-conscious diners. Works perfectly with burgers, pizza, wings, and casual dining. Serve ice cold (38-40°F) in Heineken's signature green bottle. World's best-selling NA beer for good reason. The green label you trust, zero alcohol.

name: Sam Adams "Just The Haze"
serverNotes: Non-alcoholic New England IPA from Sam Adams (Boston Beer Company). 0.5% ABV (trace), 35 IBU. Hazy appearance with citrus and tropical fruit hop character. 'Just The Haze'—all the flavor without the alcohol. Full IPA taste using special brewing process that preserves hop aroma and flavor. Great for IPA lovers who can't or don't want to drink alcohol: recovering individuals, athletes, lunch meetings, pregnancy. Impressive craft beer taste from America's craft beer pioneer. Pairs with IPA-friendly foods: spicy wings, cheddar cheese, burgers. Serve cold (40-45°F). This proves NA beer can be legitimately good. Sam Adams bringing craft to non-alcoholic.

name: Athletic "Run Wild" IPA
serverNotes: Award-winning non-alcoholic IPA from Athletic Brewing, America's premier dedicated NA brewery. Less than 0.5% ABV, 45 IBU. Bold hop character with pine, citrus, and tropical fruit notes. Full-bodied, authentic IPA taste that rivals alcoholic versions. Athletic Brewing ONLY makes non-alcoholic beer—they've perfected the craft. Perfect for athletes (hydration without alcohol), health-conscious individuals, recovery communities, or anyone avoiding alcohol. Best-in-class NA beer with multiple awards. Pairs with hoppy pairings: wings, burgers, pizza, aged cheddar. Serve cold (40-45°F). This is what NA beer should taste like. Run wild without the buzz.

name: Ceretto Vignaioli Moscato D'Asti
serverNotes: Lightly sparkling sweet wine with peach, apricot, and floral notes. Low alcohol, refreshing, not cloying. Perfect dessert wine or aperitif. Half bottle ideal for 2-3 glasses. Pairs with fruit, pastries, or light desserts.

name: La Crema Chardonnay
serverNotes: Medium-bodied California Chardonnay with apple, pear, vanilla notes. Balanced oak, approachable. Half bottle great for couples or those wanting variety. Pairs with seafood, poultry, cream sauces. Reliable crowd-pleaser.

name: Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc
serverNotes: Crisp Sauvignon Blanc with citrus, melon, herbal notes. Bright acidity, clean finish. Rated 91 pts. From renowned Duckhorn. Half bottle perfect for lighter meals. Excellent with seafood, salads, goat cheese.

name: Alphonse Mellot La Moussiere
serverNotes: Classic French Sancerre with flinty minerality, citrus, green apple. Crisp, elegant, pure. Premium Loire Valley producer. Half bottle ideal for special meals. Perfect with oysters, seafood, goat cheese. Wine lover's choice.

name: Stags' Leap, Cabernet
serverNotes: Full-bodied Napa Cabernet with blackberry, cassis, oak. Elegant tannins, long finish. Legendary producer from famous Stags Leap District. Half bottle perfect for steak dinner for two. Premium Napa at accessible format.

name: Damiano Lecrivequevne Barolo
serverNotes: Complex Barolo with rose, tar, cherry, truffle notes. Full-bodied, firm tannins, elegant. Rated 93 pts by Robert Parker. King of Italian wines. Half bottle lets guests try premium Barolo. Perfect with beef, truffle dishes, aged cheese.

name: BV "Tapestry"
serverNotes: Bordeaux-style Napa blend with layers of dark fruit, chocolate, spice. Rich, powerful, age-worthy. Highly rated (94 pts). From legendary Beaulieu Vineyard. Half bottle great for special occasions without full commitment. Pairs with prime cuts, lamb.

name: Moillard Père & Fils Brut Granville Cuvée
serverNotes: True French Champagne with fine bubbles, brioche, apple, toast notes. Elegant, balanced, celebratory. Rated 90 pts. Half bottle perfect for romantic dinners or small celebrations. Pairs with oysters, caviar, appetizers. Special occasion wine.

name: Barrel Aged Sangria
description: Enjoy Red or White 1/2 Carafe...19, Full Carafe...38
serverNotes: House specialty barrel-aged sangria available in red or white. Aged in oak barrels for smooth, complex flavor. Wine-based with fresh fruit, citrus, and subtle oak notes. Perfect for sharing—order half carafe ($19) or full carafe ($38). Great for groups, celebrations, or warm weather drinking. Pairs beautifully with appetizers, charcuterie, pizza, and lighter Italian fare. Refreshing alternative to wine by the glass. House-made recipe that's become a Via signature. Popular choice for brunch, lunch, or dinner.

name: Bonjour Beauté
description: Green Chartreuse, Hildegard Von Bingen Gin, Fresh Pineapple & Lime, Orgeat
serverNotes: Sophisticated tropical cocktail with Hildegard Von Bingen gin, Green Chartreuse, fresh pineapple, and lime. Herbal, complex, and beautifully balanced. Green Chartreuse adds 130 herbs and botanical complexity. Bright, refreshing, and conversation-worthy. For guests who appreciate craft cocktails with herbal depth. Great as aperitif or with lighter dishes. The name means 'good sun' in French—perfect for sunny moods. Pairs excellently with seafood, salads, ceviche, and citrus dishes. Elegant choice for cocktail enthusiasts.

name: Carnivale
description: Drumshanbo Brazilian Pineapple Gin, Yuzu, Lime, Cane Sugar, brûléed lime
serverNotes: Vibrant Brazilian-inspired cocktail with Dummshambo pineapple gin, exotic yuzu citrus, fresh lime, and bruleed lime garnish. Tropical, citrus-forward, and festive. Yuzu adds unique Japanese citrus character—think lemon meets mandarin. The bruleed lime creates a stunning caramelized presentation. Perfect for adventurous guests who love tropical flavors with sophistication. Great celebration cocktail or warm weather choice. Pairs wonderfully with spicy dishes, ceviche, Thai food, and tropical desserts. The name captures the festive carnival spirit.

name: Blueberry Bombshell
description: Cold River Blueberry Vodka, Lemon Sorbet, Pineapple, Prosecco Float
serverNotes: Fun, fruity signature cocktail with Cold River blueberry vodka, lemon sorbet, pineapple, and Prosecco float. Light, refreshing, and Instagram-worthy. The sorbet creates a beautiful layered effect while keeping it cold. Prosecco float adds elegant bubbles on top. Perfect for guests who want something sweet, fun, and not too strong. Great celebration drink or warm weather choice. Blueberry and pineapple create a berry-tropical fusion. Pairs wonderfully with brunch dishes, fruit desserts, light salads, and appetizers. Crowd-pleasing choice that's approachable and delicious.

name: Mango Inferno
description: Ghost Tequila, Mango, Jalapeño, Pineapple, Lime
serverNotes: Bold, spicy-sweet signature cocktail with Ghost tequila, fresh mango, jalapeño, pineapple, and lime. Tropical heat that balances sweet and spicy perfectly. The jalapeño adds real kick—great for guests who love spice. Ghost tequila brings smooth agave character. Mango and pineapple provide tropical sweetness to balance the heat. Perfect for adventurous drinkers and spicy food lovers. Great with Mexican dishes, spicy appetizers, wings, or bold flavors. The name captures the sweet fire. Ask guests about spice tolerance before recommending. Popular choice for tequila enthusiasts.

name: Espresso Martini
description: Absolut Vanilla Vodka, Bepi Tossolini Espresso Liqueur, House-Brewed Espresso, Splash of Cream
serverNotes: Classic espresso martini with Absolut vanilla vodka, espresso liqueur, house-brewed fresh espresso, and splash of cream. Rich, caffeinated, and indulgent. Perfect after-dinner cocktail that's both dessert and pick-me-up. The vanilla vodka adds subtle sweetness. Fresh espresso creates authentic coffee flavor—not artificial. Beautiful foam on top from shaking. Great for coffee lovers who want an elegant finish to their meal. Pairs wonderfully with tiramisu, chocolate desserts, cannoli, and Italian sweets. Popular choice for late dinners or those who want energy with elegance. Contains caffeine—mention to guests.

name: Mi Casa, Su Casa
description: Bribon Reposado, Fresh Lime Juice, Agave Nectar, Shiraz Float, brûléed Lime
serverNotes: Creative signature margarita with Erbbon reposado tequila, fresh lime, agave nectar, and Shiraz wine float. Unique twist on classic margarita. The red wine float creates a beautiful ombre effect and adds depth. Reposado tequila brings oak character. Bruleed lime garnish adds caramelized presentation. Perfect for tequila lovers who want something different. Great conversation starter. Pairs wonderfully with Mexican dishes, grilled meats, spicy appetizers, and bold flavors. The name means 'my house, your house'—welcoming and shareable. Popular choice for margarita fans seeking innovation.

name: Mind Over Matter
description: House Vodka by Tree House, Plantation Pineapple Rum, Aperol, Blood Orange Sorbet, Lemon, Lime, and Pineapple Juices
serverNotes: Vibrant signature cocktail with Tree House vodka, Plantation pineapple rum, Aperol, blood orange sorbet, lemon, and lime. Bright, refreshing, and beautifully layered. The blood orange sorbet creates stunning color while keeping it cold. Aperol adds Italian bitter-orange character. Multiple citrus creates complexity. Perfect for guests who love bright, refreshing cocktails with sophistication. Great warm weather choice or aperitif. Pairs wonderfully with seafood, salads, light appetizers, and citrus dishes. The name suggests mental triumph. Popular choice for those seeking something unique and photogenic.

name: The Via Mai Tai
description: Privateer Rum, Gosling's Dark Rum, Amaretto, Orgeat Syrup, Fresh Lime, Pineapple Juice and Amarena Cherry *ALLERGY: This drink recipe contains Almonds*
serverNotes: Via's twist on the classic Mai Tai with Privateer Rum, Gosling's Dark Rum, amaretto, orgeat syrup, fresh lime, pineapple juice, and Amarena cherry. Tropical, nutty, and complex. Dual rums provide depth - Privateer for brightness, Gosling's for richness. Amaretto adds almond sweetness and Italian character. Orgeat syrup (almond-based) brings authentic tiki flavor. Tropical flavors with sophisticated depth. IMPORTANT: Contains almonds—always mention allergen. Perfect for tiki cocktail lovers. Pairs wonderfully with tropical dishes, spicy food, and island-inspired cuisine. Beautiful presentation with cherry garnish. Popular celebration choice.

name: Il Gentiluomo (The Gentleman)
description: BroVo London Dry Gin, Elderflower Liqueur, Prosecco, Lemon
serverNotes: Elegant Italian-inspired signature cocktail with Bow London Dry gin, elderflower liqueur, Prosecco, and fresh lemon. Light, floral, and sophisticated. The name means 'The Gentleman' in Italian—refined and classy. Elderflower adds delicate floral sweetness. Prosecco brings bubbles and elegance. Refreshing and approachable yet complex. Perfect for guests who appreciate light, botanical cocktails. Great aperitif or celebration choice. Pairs wonderfully with seafood, salads, light appetizers, and Italian dishes. Beautiful presentation. Popular choice for those seeking something elegant and not too strong.

name: Plane Crash
description: Jefferson's Small Batch Bourbon Infused with Smoked Honey, Aperol, Amaro dell'Etna and Fresh Lemon
serverNotes: Bold, sophisticated signature cocktail inspired by the Paper Plane. Jefferson's bourbon infused with smoked honey, Aperol, Amaro dell'Etna, and fresh lemon. Complex, balanced, and conversation-worthy. The smoked honey adds depth and intrigue. Sicilian Amaro dell'Etna brings volcanic mineral character. Aperol provides bitter-orange brightness. Perfect for bourbon and amaro enthusiasts. For guests who appreciate craft cocktails with layers of flavor. Pairs excellently with charcuterie, grilled meats, Italian appetizers, and bold flavors. The name references the classic Paper Plane cocktail. Popular choice for cocktail connoisseurs.

name: Raspberry Mojito
description: Our classic made with Privateer Rum from Ipswich, MA
serverNotes: Via's signature take on the classic mojito with Privateer rum from Ipswich MA, fresh raspberries, mint, lime, and soda. Refreshing, fruity, and perfectly balanced. Made with local Massachusetts rum for New England pride. Fresh mint muddled for authentic mojito character. Raspberries add beautiful color and fruity sweetness. Also available with pineapple rum for tropical variation. Perfect for warm weather, celebrations, or guests who love classic cocktails with a twist. Pairs wonderfully with salads, seafood, light dishes, and Cuban-inspired cuisine. Crowd-pleasing favorite. Always ask if they want pineapple rum version.

name: Pear Blossom
description: Pear Purée, Lemon Juice, Fever-Tree Elderflower Tonic & Vanilla Bean

name: Toothless Mule
description: Apple Cider, Passionfruit Purée, Rosemary, Fever-Tree Ginger Beer

name: Free Spritz
description: Blood Orange Juice, Cranberry Purée, Lime Juice, Ginger Beer, Passionfruit Purée, Fever-Tree Chilled Aperitif Non-Alcoholic Syrup

name: "Rosina" Barbera D'Asti Superiore
serverNotes: Medium-bodied with bright cherry and plum flavors. High acidity makes it food-friendly. Pairs well with tomato-based dishes, charcuterie, and pasta. A classic Piedmont wine that's versatile and approachable.

name: San Felice Chianti Classico
serverNotes: Medium-bodied Sangiovese blend with red cherry, dried herbs, and hints of leather. Balanced acidity and soft tannins. Perfect with red sauce pasta, pizza, grilled meats. Classic Tuscan table wine.

name: Ascher Barolo
serverNotes: Full-bodied 'King of Wines' from Nebbiolo grape. Complex with rose, tar, dark cherry, and truffle notes. Firm tannins, high acidity. Best with rich dishes like braised meats, truffle pasta, or aged cheese. Premium Italian wine.

name: Bussola Valpolicella Ripasso
serverNotes: Medium to full-bodied with rich cherry, raisin, and spice. Made using 'ripasso' method (re-fermented on Amarone grape skins). Smooth, velvety texture. Pairs beautifully with osso buco, roasted meats, risotto. Step up from regular Valpolicella.

name: Caprizzo Brunello di Montalcino
serverNotes: Full-bodied, elegant Sangiovese from Montalcino. Complex with dark cherry, leather, tobacco, and herbs. Structured tannins, long finish. Highly rated (95 pts). Perfect for special occasions, pairs with steak, lamb, aged cheese. Premium Tuscan wine.

name: Rubio by San Polo
serverNotes: Full-bodied Super Tuscan from Montalcino producer. Dark fruit, spice, and oak. Well-structured with good aging potential. Rated 91 pts. Modern Tuscan style. Pairs excellently with red meats, aged cheese, hearty Italian dishes.

name: "O'Lillo" by Baracchi
serverNotes: Medium to full-bodied Tuscan blend with Sangiovese and international grapes. Bright red fruit, soft tannins, approachable. Modern Italian style that appeals to both traditional and new world wine drinkers. Versatile with many dishes.

name: Felino Malbec
serverNotes: Medium to full-bodied with bold dark fruit, plum, and hints of cocoa. Smooth, velvety texture with soft tannins. High altitude Argentinian wine (93 pts). Excellent with grilled meats, especially steak. Great value.

name: Stags' Leap Merlot
serverNotes: Full-bodied Napa Merlot with plush black cherry, chocolate, and subtle oak. Elegant, smooth tannins, long finish. Highly rated (95 pts). Perfect for red meat dishes. Premium California wine from legendary producer.

name: Siduri
serverNotes: Light to medium-bodied organic Oregon Pinot with red cherry, raspberry, earthy notes. Silky texture, bright acidity. Sustainably farmed. Pairs with salmon, duck, mushroom dishes, lighter fare. Classic Pacific Northwest style.

name: Cambria "Julia's Vineyard"
serverNotes: Medium-bodied California Pinot with ripe cherry, strawberry, vanilla, and spice. Smooth, approachable with balanced oak. Organic, sustainably farmed. Versatile food wine - works with poultry, pork, lighter seafood.

name: "The Pessimist" by Daou
serverNotes: Full-bodied Paso Robles Cabernet blend with dark fruit, chocolate, and spice. Well-structured with smooth tannins. Highly rated (JD 92). Bold, crowd-pleasing style. Pairs with steaks, lamb, hearty pasta. Great value premium Cab.

name: Greenwing Cabernet by Duckhorn
serverNotes: Full-bodied Washington Cabernet with dark berry, mocha, and spice. Smooth, accessible with supple tannins. From renowned Duckhorn family. Excellent with beef, pork, or aged cheese. Pacific Northwest Cab at its best.

name: Band of Vintners Cabernet
serverNotes: Full-bodied Napa Cab with rich blackberry, cassis, and oak. Structured tannins, long finish. Robert Parker 92 points. True Napa expression. Perfect for special occasions, pairs with prime cuts, lamb, strong cheese.

name: Cakebread "Mullan Road"
serverNotes: Full-bodied red blend from legendary Cakebread. Black fruit, espresso, and spice. Velvety texture with integrated tannins. From premium Washington vineyards. Excellent with beef tenderloin, short ribs. World-class winemaking.

name: Austin Hope Cabernet
serverNotes: Bold, full-bodied Paso Cabernet with jammy black fruit, vanilla, and chocolate. Rich, opulent style with big tannins. Cult favorite from Central Coast. Pairs with ribeye, BBQ, bold flavored dishes. Impressive by-the-glass selection.

name: Matua
serverNotes: Crisp, refreshing New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc with bright grapefruit, passion fruit, and fresh-cut grass. High acidity, clean finish. Perfect aperitif or with seafood, salads, goat cheese. Classic Kiwi style that's always popular.

name: Knights Bridge "Pont de Chevalier"
serverNotes: California Sauvignon Blanc with citrus, melon, and subtle oak influence. More rounded than NZ style with balanced acidity. Elegant, food-friendly. Pairs with seafood, chicken, creamy pasta. Premium domestic option.

name: La Crema
serverNotes: Medium-bodied California Chardonnay with apple, pear, vanilla, and butter notes. Partial oak aging adds richness. Balanced, approachable style. Versatile with seafood, poultry, cream sauces. Crowd-pleasing, reliable choice.

name: Rombauer
serverNotes: Full-bodied, luxurious Chardonnay with ripe tropical fruit, butter, and toasty oak. Rich, creamy texture from malolactic fermentation. Cult classic - highly sought after. Perfect with lobster, scallops, rich poultry dishes. Premium by-the-glass offering.

name: La Fiera Pinot Grigio
serverNotes: Light, crisp Italian Pinot Grigio with citrus, green apple, and mineral notes. Refreshing, easy-drinking. Perfect aperitif or with light seafood, salads, antipasto. Classic Italian white that appeals to most palates.

name: Loosen Riesling
serverNotes: Off-dry German Riesling with peach, apricot, and honey notes. Balanced sweetness with bright acidity. Versatile - works with spicy dishes, Asian cuisine, pork, or alone. Great for those who want something different.

name: GD Valle Realis Bello
serverNotes: Light-bodied Piedmont white with floral, citrus, and stone fruit notes. Crisp acidity, refreshing finish. Lesser-known Italian grape variety. Great conversation starter, pairs with seafood, light pasta, summer salads.

name: Guado Al Tasso, Vermentino
serverNotes: Medium-bodied Tuscan Vermentino with citrus, white peach, and herbal notes. Crisp with mineral finish. Coastal Italian variety. Excellent with seafood, especially shellfish. From renowned Antinori estate - premium quality.

name: Gianni Gagliardo Roero Arneis
serverNotes: Medium-bodied Piedmont white with pear, almond, and white flowers. Rich texture with refreshing acidity. Arneis is ancient grape from Barolo region. Pairs beautifully with risotto, seafood, white truffle dishes.

name: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
serverNotes: Elegant, refined Pinot Grigio from premium Alto Adige region. Citrus, white peach, clean mineral finish. More complex than typical PG. Iconic Italian brand. Excellent with seafood, light chicken, fresh mozzarella.

name: Centorri Moscato di Pavia
serverNotes: Sweet, lightly sparkling Moscato with peach, orange blossom, and honey. Low alcohol (11%). Perfect for dessert or aperitif. Appeals to sweet wine lovers. Pairs with fruit, light desserts, or alone. Easy-drinking, fun wine.

name: Pasqua Prosecco
serverNotes: Dry, refreshing Italian Prosecco with green apple, pear, and citrus. Light, effervescent with crisp finish. Perfect celebration wine or aperitif. Pairs with appetizers, fried foods, light seafood. Great value sparkler.

name: Pasqua Prosecco Brut Rose
serverNotes: Refreshing Italian Prosecco Rosé with strawberry, cherry, and floral notes. Beautiful pink color, light bubbles. Perfect for celebrations or brunch. Pairs with light appetizers, fresh fruit, salads. Festive and fun.

name: Mionetto Prosecco
serverNotes: Premium Prosecco with elegant bubbles, white peach, and floral notes. Creamy mousse, refined finish. Step up from standard Prosecco. Perfect for toasts, celebrations, or with oysters, caviar. Luxury Italian sparkler.

name: Nicolas Feuillatte Brut
serverNotes: True French Champagne with fine bubbles, brioche, citrus, and toast notes. Elegant, balanced, complex. Highly rated (92 pts). Perfect for celebrations or special occasions. Pairs with oysters, caviar, fine cuisine. Premium offering.

name: Nicolas Feuillatte Brut Rosé
serverNotes: Elegant French Rosé Champagne with red berry, brioche, and citrus. Beautiful salmon-pink color. Romantic, celebratory choice. Highly rated (90 pts). Pairs with sushi, salmon, berries, or desserts. Top-tier sparkling option.

name: World Wide Whites Flight
description: La Fiera Pinot Grigio, 2024 | Loosen Riesling, Germany, 2023 | Matua, Marlborough, NZ, 2024 | La Crema Chardonnay, Monterey, 2023
serverNotes: World tour of white wines perfect for pairing with seafood and lighter dishes. Pinot Grigio pairs beautifully with Shrimp Scampi or Fried Calamari. Riesling complements Tuna Tartare or spicy dishes. Sauvignon Blanc matches Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail or Caesar Salad. Chardonnay pairs with Chicken Piccata or Pan Seared Octopus. Progressive flight from light to full-bodied whites - perfect for sharing across appetizers and seafood entrées. Great for exploring different white wine styles with food.

name: Tuscany vs. USA Flight
description: San Felice Chianti Classico, DOCG, Tuscany, 2022 | "O'Lillo" by Baracchi, IGT, Tuscany, 2024 | Greenwing Cabernet by Duckhorn, Columbia Valley, 2023 | "The Pessimist" by Daou, 2023
serverNotes: Italian and American red wine flight perfect for pairing with our Italian classics. Chianti pairs beautifully with Chicken Parmesan, Eggplant Parmesan, or pasta with red sauce. Super Tuscan matches Ragu of Italian Meats or Three Meatballs. Washington Cabernet complements our steaks and Veal Chop Parmesan. The Pessimist pairs with Braised Short Rib or bold meat dishes. Perfect progression for Italian dinner - start lighter with pasta, finish with hearty meats. Great for sharing across multiple courses.

name: World Renowned Winemakers Flight
description: Guado Al Tasso, Vermentino, Tuscany, 2024 | Cakebread "Mullan Road", Washington, 2022 | Caparzo Brunello di Montalcino, DOCG, JS 94, 2018 | Rombauer, Chardonnay, Carneros, 2023
serverNotes: Premium wine flight for special occasions - pairs with our finest dishes. Vermentino complements Lobster Stuffed Shells or Pan Seared Octopus & Sausage. Red blend pairs with Veal Marsala or Filet Mignon. Brunello matches our premium steaks, Osso Buco, or Veal Chop Parmesan. Rombauer Chardonnay pairs with Pan Roasted Salmon or rich seafood dishes. World-class wines from legendary producers for an elevated dining experience. Perfect for anniversaries, celebrations, or wine enthusiasts wanting the best pairings with our signature dishes.

name: G.D. Vajra Nebbiolo Clare J.C.
serverNotes: Light to medium-bodied Piedmont Nebbiolo with rose petals, red cherry, herbs. From renowned biodynamic producer G.D. Vajra. More approachable than Barolo, early-drinking. Great introduction to Nebbiolo grape. Pairs with pasta, lighter meats, mushrooms. Quality producer at excellent value.

name: Valentina Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
serverNotes: Medium-bodied red from Abruzzo region with dark cherry, plum, soft tannins. Easy-drinking, versatile Italian red. Great value everyday wine. Pairs with pizza, pasta, red sauce dishes, grilled meats. Crowd-pleasing Italian style.

name: Aschen Langhe Barbera
serverNotes: Medium-bodied Piedmont Barbera with bright cherry, red fruit, and high acidity. Food-friendly, versatile. Perfect entry-level Italian red. Pairs beautifully with tomato-based pasta, charcuterie, pizza. Great value bottle from quality producer.

name: G.D. Vajra Dolcetto D'Alba
serverNotes: Light to medium-bodied Piedmont red with dark cherry, almond, and soft tannins. Easy-drinking, slightly fruity. From renowned biodynamic producer. Perfect everyday Italian wine. Pairs with antipasto, lighter pastas, roasted chicken. Approachable Piedmont style.

name: Castella Banfi Rosso di Montalcino
serverNotes: Younger, more approachable Sangiovese from Brunello producer. Medium-bodied with cherry, herbs, and soft tannins. Great introduction to Montalcino wines at accessible price. Pairs with red sauce pasta, grilled meats, pizza. Baby Brunello style.

name: "Rosina" Barbera D'Asti by Garretto
serverNotes: Classic Piedmont Barbera with vibrant acidity, bright cherry, plum notes. DOCG quality from traditional producer. Food-friendly versatility. Perfect with tomato dishes, charcuterie, pasta. Available by the glass too - great for larger parties wanting to share.

name: San Felice Chianti Classico
serverNotes: Classic Tuscan Sangiovese with red cherry, dried herbs, leather. Balanced acidity, soft tannins. Quintessential Chianti from historic producer. Perfect house bottle for Italian dinner. Also by the glass. Pairs with everything Italian - pizza, pasta, grilled meats.

name: Ca' Del Baio Barbaresco Autinbej
serverNotes: Elegant Nebbiolo-based wine with rose petals, red cherry, tar. Queen of Piedmont wines. Softer tannins than Barolo, earlier drinking. Sophisticated choice. Pairs with duck, truffle dishes, aged cheese. Premium Piedmont experience at accessible price.

name: Benanti Etna Rosso
serverNotes: Unique Sicilian red from volcanic Mt. Etna slopes. Nerello Mascalese grape with red cherry, herbs, mineral, smoke. Light-bodied, high acidity. Trendy, food-friendly Italian wine. Pairs with grilled vegetables, fish, lighter meats. Conversation starter.

name: Ascheri Barolo
serverNotes: King of Italian wines from Nebbiolo grape. Complex with rose, tar, dark cherry, truffle. Full-bodied, firm tannins, elegant. Available by the glass too. Perfect for special occasions or serious wine lovers. Pairs with braised meats, truffle pasta, aged cheese.

name: Bussola Valpolicella Ripasso
serverNotes: Rich Veneto red using ripasso method (re-fermented on Amarone skins). Cherry, raisin, spice, velvety texture. Also by the glass. Step up from regular Valpolicella. Pairs beautifully with osso buco, roasted meats, risotto. Impressive but approachable.

name: Antinori Chianti Classico Riserva
serverNotes: Premium Chianti from legendary 600-year-old producer. Richer, more complex than regular Chianti with dark cherry, spice, oak. Aged longer, fuller body. Prestigious Italian wine family. Pairs with bistecca, wild boar, mature cheese. Step-up Tuscan choice.

name: Carpineto Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Riserva
pronunciation: car-pee-NAY-toh VEE-noh NOH-bee-lay dee mon-tay-pull-chee-AH-noh ree-SEHR-vah
serverNotes: Elegant Tuscan Sangiovese from Montepulciano area. Cherry, plum, leather, and spice. Riserva = aged longer, more complex. Rated 91 pts. Pairs with roasted meats, game, mature cheese. Sophisticated alternative to Chianti or Brunello.

name: Caparzo Brunello di Montalcino
serverNotes: Classic Brunello from historic producer. 100% Sangiovese with dark cherry, leather, tobacco, herbs. Full-bodied, structured tannins, age-worthy. Highly rated (95 pts). Prestigious Tuscan wine. Pairs with bistecca, lamb, aged cheese. Special occasion choice.

name: G.D. Vajra Barolo Albe
serverNotes: Premium Barolo from renowned biodynamic producer. Classic Nebbiolo with rose, tar, red fruit, complexity. Elegant, balanced, traditional style. From quality-focused family winery. Pairs with braised beef, truffle dishes, aged cheese. Serious wine for connoisseurs.

name: Altesino Brunello di Montalcino
serverNotes: Premium Brunello from iconic producer. Rich, concentrated Sangiovese with dark fruit, spice, earth. Full-bodied, powerful, age-worthy. One of Montalcino's finest. Pairs with bistecca Fiorentina, wild boar, truffles. Investment-quality Italian wine.

name: Gagliardo Barolo
serverNotes: Premium Barolo with complex aromatics - rose petals, tar, dark cherry, licorice. Full-bodied, firm tannins, long aging potential. From prestigious Piedmont estate. Perfect for special celebrations or serious wine collectors. Pairs with braised meats, truffle dishes, aged Parm esano.

name: Livio Sassetti Brunello di Montalcino
serverNotes: Outstanding Brunello rated 96 pts. Rich, concentrated Sangiovese with exceptional depth. Dark cherry, leather, tobacco, herbs, minerals. Full-bodied, powerful structure, cellar-worthy. From small artisan producer. Ultimate Tuscan wine for collectors. Pairs with Florentine steak, wild boar, aged cheese.

name: Tommasi Amarone
serverNotes: Legendary dried-grape wine from Veneto. Full-bodied, rich, velvety with raisin, chocolate, spice. Made from partially dried grapes, concentrated flavors. High alcohol, intense. Pairs with braised meats, game, strong cheese, or chocolate dessert. Unique Italian wine experience.

name: Gaja Pieve Santa Restituta Brunello di Montalcino
serverNotes: Legendary Gaja's Brunello estate wine. Elegant, refined Sangiovese with red fruit, spice, mineral. Rated 94 pts. From Italy's most famous winemaker. Prestigious choice for collectors. Pairs with Florentine steak, game, truffle dishes. Icon wine.

name: Petrolo "Boggina C" Riserva
serverNotes: Premium Tuscan blend from boutique producer. 100% Sangiovese, modern style with concentrated fruit, oak, structure. Rated 95 pts. Cellar-worthy, powerful. For serious collectors. Pairs with prime cuts, braised meats, aged cheese. World-class Tuscan wine.

name: Petrolo Galatrona
serverNotes: Exceptional 100% Merlot from Tuscany. Nearly perfect 98 pts rating. Rich, velvety, concentrated black fruit, chocolate, spice. World-class Super Tuscan. Competes with Bordeaux's best. For collectors and special celebrations. Pairs with prime beef, lamb, game. Remarkable wine.

name: Gagliardo "Fossati" Barolo
serverNotes: Single-vineyard Barolo from premium Fossati cru. Complex Nebbiolo with rose, tar, cherry, truffle. Rated 93 pts. Elegant, age-worthy, traditional style. From family estate. Ultimate Piedmont expression. Pairs with white truffle, braised beef, aged Parmigiano. Collector's choice.

name: Bertani Amarone Classico
serverNotes: Legendary Amarone from historic Veneto producer (since 1857). Full-bodied dried-grape wine with raisin, chocolate, spice, power. Traditional style, age-worthy. Icon Italian wine. Pairs with rich meats, game, blue cheese, or chocolate. Ultimate expression of Amarone.

name: Giodo, Brunello di Montalcino
serverNotes: Near-perfect Brunello rated 99 pts! Exceptional Sangiovese with extraordinary depth, complexity. Dark cherry, leather, tobacco, minerals. Full-bodied, powerful, cellar-worthy for decades. From small artisan producer. Ultimate Tuscan wine. For serious collectors only. Pairs with Florentine steak, truffles.

name: Gaja "Sugarille" Pieve Santa Restituta Brunello di Montalcino
pronunciation: GAH-yah soo-gah-REEL-yay pee-AY-vay SAN-tah res-tee-TOO-tah broo-NELL-oh
serverNotes: Gaja's single-vineyard Brunello. Exceptional quality rated 96 pts. Complex, elegant Sangiovese with remarkable depth. From Italy's most legendary producer. Investment-grade wine. Pairs with finest cuts, white truffle, aged Parmigiano. Ultimate Italian wine experience.

name: Gaja Sperss Barolo
serverNotes: Gaja's pinnacle Barolo, rated 97 pts. One of Italy's greatest wines. Extraordinary Nebbiolo with phenomenal complexity, depth, elegance. Single-vineyard masterpiece. Cellar for decades. For ultimate collectors and special once-in-lifetime celebrations. Pairs with white truffle, finest cuts. Legendary wine.

name: "O'Lillo" by Baracchi
serverNotes: Modern Tuscan blend with Sangiovese and international grapes. Bright red fruit, soft tannins, approachable. Also by the glass. Great introduction to Super Tuscan style. Versatile food wine. Pairs with grilled meats, pasta, pizza. Appealing to both traditional and modern wine drinkers.

name: "Ardito" by Baracchi
serverNotes: Premium Super Tuscan from Baracchi estate, rated 93 pts. Rich, concentrated with dark fruit, spice, and oak. Same producer as O'Lillo but more structured and complex. Modern winemaking with excellent aging potential. Pairs with bistecca, lamb, aged cheese. Step-up from O'Lillo for serious wine lovers.

name: Tenuta San Guido "Le Difese"
serverNotes: From legendary Sassicaia estate. Cabernet-Sangiovese blend, rated 92 pts. Dark fruit, elegant structure. Baby Sassicaia - accessible introduction to iconic producer. Pairs with grilled meats, pasta, game. Prestigious name at attainable price.

name: Gaja Ca'Marcanda "Magari"
serverNotes: Legendary Gaja's Tuscan estate wine from Bolgheri. Bordeaux-style blend with Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Merlot. Red fruit, spice, elegance. Approachable Gaja offering from Italy's most famous winemaker. Pairs with roasted meats, game, aged cheese. Collector-worthy producer at accessible price.

name: Antinori Tignanello
serverNotes: Legendary wine that invented Super Tuscan category in 1970s. Sangiovese-Cabernet blend with dark fruit, spice, oak. Complex, age-worthy, iconic. From 600-year-old Antinori family. Benchmark Italian wine. Pairs with bistecca, lamb, truffles. Must-try for serious collectors.

name: Gaja Ca'Marcanda "Camarcanda"
serverNotes: Gaja's flagship Tuscan wine rated 95 pts by Robert Parker. Bordeaux-style blend with power, elegance, complexity. Full-bodied, age-worthy. From legendary producer's Tuscan estate. Investment-grade wine. Pairs with finest cuts, game, truffles. Ultimate Gaja Tuscany expression.

name: Ornellaia, Bolgheri
serverNotes: Near-perfect 99 pts! One of Italy's greatest wines. Bordeaux-style blend with extraordinary depth, elegance. Rich black fruit, spice, structure. Competes with First Growth Bordeaux. Cellar for decades. For serious collectors and special celebrations. Pairs with finest cuisine, truffles, prime cuts. Icon wine.

name: Sassicaia
serverNotes: Legendary wine that started Super Tuscan movement. Cabernet blend rated 98 pts. Elegant, powerful, age-worthy. Only Super Tuscan with its own DOC. Investment-grade, world-class. For ultimate collectors. Pairs with finest beef, game, truffles. One of Italy's greatest wines ever.

name: Antinori Solaia
serverNotes: Antinori's masterpiece, rated 98 pts. Cabernet-dominant blend with extraordinary complexity, power, elegance. From single vineyard next to Tignanello. One of world's greatest wines. Cellar for decades. For once-in-lifetime celebrations, serious collectors. Pairs with finest cuisine, white truffle. Ultimate Italian wine experience.

name: "Domaine Bousquet Malbec"
serverNotes: Organic Argentine Malbec with ripe plum, blackberry, smooth tannins. Full-bodied, fruit-forward. Great value introduction to Mendoza Malbec. Pairs with grilled meats, empanadas, BBQ. Crowd-pleasing Argentine style.

name: Felino Malbec
serverNotes: Premium Mendoza Malbec rated 93 pts. Rich, concentrated with dark fruit, chocolate, spice. From renowned Paul Hobbs. Also by the glass. Velvety texture, balanced. Pairs with ribeye, lamb, BBQ. High-quality Argentine Malbec.

name: Stags' Leap Merlot
serverNotes: Elegant Napa Merlot from legendary estate. Plum, black cherry, chocolate, smooth tannins. Softer than Cabernet, approachable. From famous Stags Leap District. Pairs with duck, pork, mushroom dishes, softer cheeses. Premium Napa Merlot.

name: Red Schooner Malbec by Caymus
serverNotes: Unique Argentine Malbec finished in Caymus' Napa facility. Rich, bold with dark fruit, smooth tannins. Caymus style meets Argentine fruit. Also by the glass. Conversation starter. Pairs with steaks, BBQ, bold dishes. Innovative collaboration wine.

name: Grgich Merlot
serverNotes: Premium Napa Merlot from legendary Grgich Hills Estate (est. 1977). Plum, leather, earth, integrated tannins. From the winemaker who put California on the map with the 1976 Judgment of Paris. Well-aged, ready to drink now. Pairs with duck, pork, truffle dishes, aged cheese. Iconic producer, sophisticated Merlot.

name: Duckhorn Merlot
serverNotes: Legendary Napa Merlot rated 90 pts. Made Merlot fashionable in America. Rich, velvety with plum, chocolate, spice. Benchmark Merlot. Consistently excellent. Pairs with duck, pork, mushrooms, softer dishes. Premier American Merlot producer.

name: La Crema Pinot Noir
serverNotes: Medium-bodied California Pinot with cherry, strawberry, spice. Smooth, approachable, balanced. From quality Sonoma producer. Versatile food wine. Pairs with salmon, duck, pork, mushroom dishes. Reliable crowd-pleasing Pinot.

name: Benessere Zinfandel
serverNotes: Bold Sonoma Zinfandel with blackberry, raspberry jam, spice. Full-bodied, fruit-forward, peppery finish. Classic California Zin style. Pairs with BBQ ribs, burgers, spicy dishes, pizza. Quintessential American red.

name: Siduri
serverNotes: Elegant Oregon Pinot with red cherry, raspberry, earthy notes. Light to medium-bodied, silky texture. Also by the glass. Classic Pacific Northwest style. Pairs with salmon, duck, mushrooms, lighter fare. Pure Oregon Pinot expression.

name: Cambria "Julia's Vineyard"
serverNotes: California Pinot with ripe cherry, strawberry, vanilla, spice. Medium-bodied, smooth with balanced oak. Also by the glass. Organic, sustainably farmed. Pairs with poultry, pork, lighter seafood, salmon. Versatile crowd-pleaser.

name: Rombauer Zinfandel
serverNotes: Premium California Zinfandel from legendary Rombauer family. Rich, jammy with blackberry, spice, vanilla. Full-bodied, opulent style. From famous Chardonnay producer. Pairs with BBQ, burgers, grilled meats, bold dishes. Step-up Zin choice.

name: "Machete" by Orin Swift
serverNotes: Bold Petite Sirah from cult producer Orin Swift. Intense, inky with blackberry, pepper, spice. Full-bodied, powerful tannins. Different from typical reds - conversation starter. Pairs with BBQ, steaks, game, bold flavors. For adventurous wine lovers.

name: Domaine Drouhin Pinot Noir
serverNotes: Premium Oregon Pinot rated 93 pts. From legendary Burgundy family's Oregon estate. Elegant, complex with red fruit, earth, spice. Burgundian style in Oregon. Pairs with duck, salmon, mushrooms, truffles. Serious Pinot for connoisseurs.

name: Wayfarer, Pinot Noir
serverNotes: Premium coastal Pinot from Pahlmeyer family's estate. Complex, elegant with red fruit, spice, mineral. Extreme coastal vineyard, cool climate. Burgundian style, age-worthy. For serious Pinot collectors. Pairs with duck, salmon, mushrooms, truffles. Elite California Pinot.

name: Bonanza Cabernet by Caymus
serverNotes: From legendary Caymus family. Rich, approachable California Cabernet with dark fruit, smooth tannins. Great value entry to Caymus style. Pairs with steaks, burgers, BBQ. Perfect everyday Napa-style Cab at accessible price.

name: "The Pessimist" by Daou
serverNotes: Bold Paso Robles Cabernet blend with dark fruit, chocolate, spice. Full-bodied, smooth tannins. Also by the glass. Crowd-pleasing style. Pairs with steaks, lamb, hearty pasta. Great value premium Cab from Central Coast.

name: Greenwing Cabernet by Duckhorn
serverNotes: Washington Cabernet from renowned Duckhorn family. Dark berry, mocha, spice. Smooth, accessible. Also by the glass. From legendary producer at great value. Pairs with beef, pork, aged cheese. Pacific Northwest Cab at its best.

name: Band of Vinters Cabernet
serverNotes: True Napa Cabernet rated 92 pts by Robert Parker. Rich blackberry, cassis, oak. Structured tannins, long finish. Also by the glass. Authentic Napa expression. Pairs with prime cuts, lamb, strong cheese. Great value Napa Cab.

name: Cakebread "Mullan Road"
serverNotes: From legendary Cakebread winery. Washington red blend with black fruit, espresso, spice. Velvety texture, integrated tannins. Also by the glass. World-class winemaking at accessible price. Pairs with beef tenderloin, short ribs, lamb.

name: La Crema Cabernet
serverNotes: Sonoma Cabernet rated 92 pts. Dark fruit, vanilla, spice. Balanced, approachable style. From quality producer known for consistency. Pairs with steaks, burgers, pasta. Reliable crowd-pleasing California Cab.

name: Mount Peak "Gravity"
serverNotes: Mountain Cabernet from Atlas Peak appellation. Dark fruit, minerality, structure. Elevated, cooler climate produces concentrated flavors. Boutique Napa producer. Pairs with grilled meats, game, aged cheese. Premium mountain Cab.

name: Austin Hope Cabernet, 1 Liter
serverNotes: Cult favorite in 1 Liter bottle! Bold Paso Cabernet with jammy black fruit, vanilla, chocolate. Rich, opulent style. Also by the glass. Extra large format great for groups. Pairs with ribeye, BBQ, bold dishes. Impressive value statement.

name: Mount Peak "Sentinel"
serverNotes: Premium mountain Cabernet from Atlas Peak. Aged, mature wine with complexity. Dark fruit, spice, earth. Boutique producer. Pairs with game, braised meats, aged cheese. Serious mountain Cab with bottle age.

name: Stonestreet Cabernet
serverNotes: Mature Sonoma Cabernet rated 90 pts. Well-aged with secondary flavors. Smooth tannins, evolved complexity. From quality Alexander Valley. Pairs with prime cuts, lamb, mature cheese. Ready to drink now with bottle age.

name: Duckhorn Cabernet
serverNotes: Classic Napa Cabernet from legendary producer. Elegant, balanced with dark fruit, oak, structure. Consistent quality, benchmark wine. Perfect for special dinners or collectors. Pairs with prime beef, lamb, aged cheese. Reliable premium Napa choice.

name: Stonestreet Estate Cabernet
serverNotes: Premium estate Cabernet from mountain vineyards. Rich, concentrated with dark fruit, spice. Age-worthy, complex. From acclaimed Sonoma producer. Pairs with steaks, game, truffle dishes. Serious Sonoma Cab at $100 milestone.

name: Caymus Cabernet
serverNotes: Legendary Napa Cabernet. Rich, velvety, opulent style with dark fruit, vanilla, chocolate. Smooth, approachable. Iconic producer, consistently high quality. Perfect for celebrations or steak dinners. Pairs with prime cuts, lamb. Quintessential Napa experience.

name: Doubleback Cabernet
serverNotes: Premium Washington Cabernet from Drew Bledsoe's (NFL QB) winery. Elegant, structured with dark fruit, spice. Cult favorite from Walla Walla. Collector's item. Pairs with finest cuts, game, aged cheese. Celebrity winemaker with serious quality.

name: Knights Bridge Cabernet
serverNotes: Napa Valley Cabernet rated 90 pts. Elegant, refined style with dark fruit, oak. From boutique Knights Valley estate. Also by the glass in Sauvignon Blanc. Premium quality. Pairs with prime cuts, lamb, game. Sophisticated Napa choice.

name: Revana "Estate" Cabernet
serverNotes: Outstanding Napa Cabernet rated 95 pts. Rich, concentrated with exceptional depth. Estate grown, boutique producer. Investment-quality wine. Cellar-worthy. Pairs with finest beef, game, truffles. Serious collector's Napa Cab.

name: Caymus "Special Selection" Cabernet
serverNotes: Caymus' top wine. Ultra-rich, velvety Napa Cabernet with layers of dark fruit, chocolate, vanilla. Full-bodied, opulent, luxurious. Consistently high scores. For special celebrations or serious collectors. Pairs with finest cuts, truffles. Ultimate Caymus experience.

name: Quintessa
serverNotes: Perfect 100 pts! Iconic Rutherford estate blend. Extraordinary elegance, complexity, depth. One of Napa's greatest wines. Biodynamic farming. Investment-grade, cellar for decades. For ultimate celebrations or collectors. Pairs with finest cuisine, truffles. Icon Napa wine.

name: Chappellet Prichard Hill Estate Cabernet
serverNotes: Near-perfect mountain Cabernet rated 99 pts by Robert Parker. From legendary Prichard Hill vineyard. Extraordinary power, elegance, complexity. Cellar-worthy for decades. For serious collectors only. Pairs with finest beef, game, truffles. One of Napa's greatest sites.

name: Joseph Phelps Insignia
serverNotes: Legendary Napa blend rated 99 pts. Bordeaux-style masterpiece with decades of acclaim. Rich, complex, age-worthy. Icon American wine since 1974. Investment-grade. For ultimate celebrations or collectors. Pairs with finest cuisine, truffles, prime cuts. Benchmark California wine.

name: Shafer Hillside Select Cabernet
serverNotes: Perfect 100 pts! One of America's greatest Cabernets. From legendary Stags Leap hillside vineyard. Extraordinary power, elegance, complexity. Cellar for decades. Consistently perfect scores. For once-in-lifetime celebrations, serious collectors. Pairs with finest cuisine, white truffle. Ultimate Napa experience.

name: "Les Deux Tours" by LaDoucette
serverNotes: Crisp French Sauvignon Blanc from Loire Valley. Citrus, green apple, mineral, grass. Bright acidity, refreshing. From quality Loire producer. Pairs with oysters, goat cheese, seafood, salads. Classic French style, elegant.

name: Matua
serverNotes: New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc with grapefruit, passionfruit, lime. Vibrant, tropical, zesty. Also by the glass. From pioneering Kiwi producer. Pairs with seafood, sushi, salads, Asian cuisine. Crowd-pleasing NZ style.

name: Cloudy Bay
serverNotes: Iconic New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc that made Marlborough famous. Grapefruit, passionfruit, herbs. Vibrant, pure, elegant. Benchmark NZ producer. Pairs with seafood, oysters, sushi, goat cheese. Premium Kiwi classic.

name: Hubert Brochard
serverNotes: Classic French Sancerre with citrus, flint, mineral. Crisp, elegant, bone-dry. From quality Loire producer. True expression of terroir. Pairs with oysters, goat cheese, seafood, delicate dishes. Premium French Sauvignon Blanc.

name: Knights Bridge "Pont de Chevalier"
serverNotes: California Sauvignon Blanc with grapefruit, melon, grass. Crisp, balanced, fresh. From boutique Napa producer. Bordeaux-inspired style. Pairs with seafood, salads, oysters, goat cheese. Premium California Sauv Blanc.

name: La Crema
serverNotes: California Chardonnay with apple, citrus, vanilla, oak. Medium-bodied, balanced, creamy texture. Also by the glass. From quality producer. Pairs with chicken, seafood, pasta with cream sauce. Crowd-pleasing California style.

name: Knights Bridge "KB"
serverNotes: Napa Valley Chardonnay with citrus, apple, butter, oak. Medium to full-bodied, rich texture. Also by the glass. From boutique producer. Pairs with lobster, chicken, risotto, creamy dishes. Premium California Chardonnay.

name: Grgich
serverNotes: Legendary Napa Chardonnay rated 95 pts. Won 1976 Judgment of Paris! Citrus, apple, butter, oak. Rich, balanced, elegant. Historic producer. Pairs with lobster, crab, chicken, rich dishes. Iconic California Chardonnay.

name: Rombauer
serverNotes: Cult favorite California Chardonnay. Rich, buttery with tropical fruit, vanilla, oak. Full-bodied, creamy, opulent. Most requested Chardonnay in America. Pairs with lobster, crab, chicken, creamy pasta. Ultra-popular premium choice.

name: Chappellet Grower Collection
serverNotes: Premium Carneros Chardonnay rated 93 pts. Citrus, apple, oak, complexity. Balanced, elegant with bottle age. From legendary mountain Cabernet producer. Pairs with lobster, scallops, chicken, rich fish. Sophisticated aged Chardonnay.

name: Shafer "Red Shoulder Ranch"
serverNotes: Premium Napa Chardonnay from legendary Shafer estate. Citrus, apple, butter, mineral. Balanced, elegant, refined. From cult Cabernet producer. Pairs with lobster, scallops, fine dining, rich seafood. Collector-quality Chardonnay.

name: Knights Bridge West Block
serverNotes: Single-vineyard Napa Chardonnay with citrus, stone fruit, oak. Rich, complex, balanced. From boutique estate's best block. Limited production. Pairs with lobster, fine dining, rich dishes. Premium small-lot Chardonnay.

name: Wayfarer
serverNotes: Near-perfect Chardonnay rated 97 pts! From Pahlmeyer family's coastal estate. Citrus, mineral, oak, complexity. Elegant, Burgundian style. Extreme coastal vineyard. For serious collectors. Pairs with lobster, fine dining, truffles. Elite California Chardonnay.

name: Batasiolo "Sunsi"
serverNotes: Light, crisp Piedmont white blend with citrus, white flowers. Refreshing, easy-drinking. Great value Italian white. Pairs with antipasto, seafood, salads, lighter dishes. Perfect everyday white wine.

name: Sorbara Lambrusco Rosé
serverNotes: Lightly sparkling Italian rosé with strawberry, raspberry, refreshing bubbles. Off-dry, fun, festive. Unique style - conversation starter. Pairs with charcuterie, pizza, fried foods, brunch. Playful, approachable sparkler.

name: Elena Walch Gewürztraminer
serverNotes: Aromatic Italian white with lychee, rose petals, spice. Exotic, off-dry, full-bodied. From quality Alto Adige producer. Pairs with Asian cuisine, spicy dishes, duck, strong cheeses. Bold, distinctive white wine.

name: La Fiera Pinot Grigio
serverNotes: Crisp Italian Pinot Grigio with citrus, green apple, mineral notes. Light, refreshing, clean. Also by the glass. Perfect aperitif wine. Pairs with seafood, salads, antipasto, light pasta. Classic Italian white that appeals to most palates.

name: Loosen Riesling
serverNotes: Classic German Riesling with apple, peach, mineral notes. Off-dry, balanced sweetness with acidity. Also by the glass. From legendary Dr. Loosen. Pairs with spicy foods, Asian cuisine, pork, duck. Gateway to German Riesling.

name: Trimbach Riesling
serverNotes: Dry French Riesling rated 92 pts. Citrus, mineral, steel. Crisp, bone-dry style. From legendary Alsace producer. Pairs with oysters, seafood, Asian cuisine, goat cheese. Premium Old World Riesling for serious wine lovers.

name: Benanti Etna Bianco
serverNotes: Unique Sicilian white from volcanic Mt. Etna slopes. Citrus, mineral, smoke, saline notes. Crisp, distinctive terroir. Trendy, food-friendly. Pairs with seafood, fish, oysters, grilled vegetables. Conversation starter wine.

name: G.D Vajra Rosa Bella
serverNotes: Elegant Piedmont rosé from biodynamic producer G.D. Vajra. Light, fresh with strawberry, citrus, minerals. Delicate, refreshing. From prestigious Barolo producer. Pairs with appetizers, salads, seafood, summer dishes. Quality Italian rosé.

name: Gianni Gagliardo Roero Arneis
serverNotes: Medium-bodied Piedmont white with pear, almond, white flowers. Rich texture with refreshing acidity. Ancient grape from Barolo region. Also by the glass. Pairs with risotto, seafood, white truffle dishes. Quality Piedmont white.

name: Guado Al Tasso, Vermentino
serverNotes: Crisp Tuscan white from legendary Antinori estate. Citrus, white peach, herbal notes. Fresh, Mediterranean style. From prestigious producer. Pairs with seafood, shellfish, light pasta, grilled fish. Premium coastal Italian white.

name: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
serverNotes: Iconic Italian Pinot Grigio that made the grape famous. Crisp, clean with citrus, mineral. Elegant, refined. Most recognized Italian white brand. Pairs with seafood, appetizers, salads, light dishes. Premium benchmark Pinot Grigio.

name: Centorri Moscato di Pavia
serverNotes: Lightly sparkling Italian Moscato with peach, apricot, honey, floral notes. Sweet, low alcohol, refreshing. Light bubbles, not cloying. Perfect dessert wine or aperitif. Pairs with fruit tarts, cheese, light desserts. Crowd-pleasing sweet sparkler.

name: Pasqua Prosecco Brut Rosé
serverNotes: Italian Prosecco Rosé with strawberry, raspberry, floral notes. Light, fresh, festive bubbles. Beautiful pink color. Trendy, approachable. Perfect for celebrations, brunch, aperitif. Pairs with salads, appetizers, brunch dishes. Fun alternative to Champagne.

name: Benvolio Prosecco
serverNotes: Classic Italian Prosecco with green apple, pear, floral notes. Light, fresh, crisp bubbles. Dry style, refreshing. Perfect for aperitif or celebrations. Great value alternative to Champagne. Pairs with appetizers, seafood, light dishes. Crowd-pleasing sparkler.

name: Taittinger Prestige Brut
serverNotes: Classic French Champagne from historic house. Fine bubbles, apple, brioche, elegant. Light, delicate style perfect for aperitif or throughout meal. Great value prestige Champagne. Pairs with oysters, seafood, appetizers. Celebration wine from renowned producer.

name: Nicolas Feuillatte Brut
serverNotes: Highly rated Champagne (92 pts). Fine bubbles, brioche, citrus, toast. Elegant, balanced, complex. Also by the glass. Perfect for celebrations or throughout dinner. Pairs with oysters, caviar, fine cuisine. Reliable premium Champagne choice.

name: Nicolas Feuillatte Brut Rosé
serverNotes: Elegant French Rosé Champagne with red berry, brioche, citrus. Beautiful salmon-pink color. Rated 90 pts. Also by the glass. Romantic, celebratory choice. Pairs with sushi, salmon, berries, desserts. Perfect for special occasions, anniversaries.

name: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin, Brut (Yellow Label)
serverNotes: Iconic Yellow Label Champagne from legendary house. Rich, full-bodied with apple, brioche, toast. Rated 90 pts. Instantly recognizable, prestigious. Perfect for celebrations, toasts. Pairs with seafood, fried foods, caviar. Most famous Champagne in the world.

name: Louis Roederer Blanc de Blancs
serverNotes: 100% Chardonnay Champagne rated 94 pts. Elegant, refined, pure with citrus, mineral, brioche. Lighter, more delicate than blended styles. From Cristal producer. Vintage dated - special quality. Pairs with oysters, seafood, delicate cuisine. For Champagne connoisseurs.

name: Dom Pérignon
serverNotes: Legendary prestige cuvée rated 98 pts. One of world's greatest Champagnes. Extraordinary complexity, elegance, depth. Toast, brioche, citrus, minerals. Vintage only - no non-vintage. For ultimate celebrations, collectors. Pairs with finest cuisine, caviar, truffles. Icon Champagne experience.

name: Moutard Père & Fils Brut Grande Cuvée
Eagle Rare
serverNotes: Premium Kentucky straight bourbon aged a full 10 years from Buffalo Trace Distillery. 90 proof. Rich with caramel, vanilla, oak, and honey notes. Smooth, complex, and offers excellent value for the age statement. Single barrel selection ensures unique character. Perfect neat to appreciate the complexity, on rocks for easy sipping, or in upscale cocktails like Old Fashioneds. Pairs beautifully with BBQ ribs, smoked brisket, chocolate desserts, and pecan pie. Highly sought-after and hard to find—a true bourbon enthusiast's choice. The 10-year age creates exceptional depth.

name: Four Roses Small Batch
serverNotes: Small batch Kentucky bourbon from Four Roses' award-winning distillery. 90 proof. Blend of four distinct bourbon recipes creates unique complexity with fruit, spice, caramel, and oak. Well-balanced, approachable, and incredibly smooth. Uses two different mashbills and two yeast strains for layered flavor. Great introduction for bourbon beginners or excellent in cocktails like Manhattans. Pairs with grilled chicken, pork chops, aged cheddar, and spiced nuts. Reliable, crowd-pleasing choice that won't disappoint. Four Roses is known for their unique recipe approach.

name: Jefferson's Small Batch Bourbon
serverNotes: Elegant small-batch Kentucky bourbon from Jefferson's artisan distillery. 82.3 proof. Features caramel, vanilla, warm baking spice, and bright citrus notes. Smooth, refined, and carefully crafted using traditional methods. Each batch is meticulously selected for balance and complexity. Perfect for sipping neat to appreciate the nuanced flavors or in premium cocktails. Pairs excellently with dark chocolate truffles, hand-rolled cigars, Texas BBQ, and bourbon-glazed salmon. Quality craft bourbon that showcases Kentucky distilling at its finest. Jefferson's focuses on innovation and quality.

name: Maker's Mark
serverNotes: Iconic hand-dipped red wax sealed wheated bourbon from Maker's Mark distillery. 90 proof. Unique mash bill uses soft red winter wheat instead of rye for exceptionally smooth, mellow character with sweet caramel, vanilla, and wheat bread notes. No harsh burn—perfect for those who find traditional bourbons too spicy. Hand-rotated during aging for even maturation. Excellent for classic Old Fashioneds, neat sipping, or on rocks. Pairs beautifully with Kansas City BBQ ribs, gourmet burgers, bread pudding, and caramel desserts. Classic American bourbon with instantly recognizable bottle. Family-owned since 1953.

name: Buffalo Trace
serverNotes: Award-winning Kentucky straight bourbon from the legendary Buffalo Trace Distillery. 90 proof. Features vanilla, toffee, baking spice, and toasted oak. Smooth, balanced, and incredibly versatile. Excellent value for quality—consistently wins awards above its price point. Made with corn, rye, and malted barley, aged in new charred oak barrels. Perfect for craft cocktails like Boulevardiers or sipping neat. Pairs wonderfully with Memphis BBQ, smoked brisket, praline pecans, and maple bacon. Benchmark bourbon from America's oldest continuously operating distillery (since 1787). Buffalo Trace campus is a National Historic Landmark.

name: Elijah Craig
serverNotes: Small-batch Kentucky bourbon named after bourbon's founding father, Reverend Elijah Craig. 94 proof. Rich, full-bodied with caramel, vanilla, subtle smoke, and warm spice. Aged 8-12 years for exceptional depth. Bold yet smooth character from Heaven Hill Distillery. Great neat to appreciate the complexity or in a classic Manhattan. The slight smoke comes from deep barrel char. Pairs perfectly with ribeye steak, dark chocolate truffles, hand-rolled cigars, and bourbon pecan pie. Reverend Craig is credited with being the first to age whiskey in charred oak barrels (1789). Premium small-batch quality.

name: High West
serverNotes: Unique Utah bourbon blend from High West, the first legal distillery in Utah since 1870. 92 proof. Carefully crafted blend of straight bourbons featuring caramel, vanilla, rye spice, and refreshing mint notes. Smooth with a spirited kick. Honors the Western whiskey-making tradition with modern innovation. Great for craft cocktails like Whiskey Sours or neat over a large ice cube. The rye content adds complexity. Pairs wonderfully with Western BBQ, elk or bison steaks, venison, and classic apple pie. High West is located at 7,000 feet in Park City's historic buildings. True Western craft bourbon with mountain character.

name: WhistlePig Piggyback, 6 Year
serverNotes: Vermont straight rye whiskey aged 6 years from WhistlePig, America's premier rye whiskey specialist. 96.56 proof. Bold, spicy character with rye grain, mint, caramel, and black pepper. Flavorful yet smooth from extended aging. 100% rye mash bill creates intense but balanced profile. Perfect for rye-forward cocktails like Sazeracs or Manhattans, or neat for rye enthusiasts. Aged in American oak. Pairs excellently with smoked pastrami, applewood bacon, aged Gruyere, and dark chocolate bark. WhistlePig Farm is Vermont's first whiskey distillery since Prohibition. Craft rye excellence at its finest.

name: Basil Hayden's
serverNotes: High-rye Kentucky bourbon from Jim Beam's premium collection named after a legendary distiller. 80 proof (40% ABV). Delicate, light-bodied with unique high-rye mash bill creating spicy character alongside tea, peppermint, and honey notes. Smooth and incredibly approachable—perfect introduction for bourbon newcomers or guests who prefer lighter spirits. Great in cocktails like Whiskey Smashes or with a splash of water to open up flavors. The lower proof makes it exceptionally drinkable. Pairs wonderfully with grilled chicken breast, pork tenderloin, pan-seared duck, and lighter Italian fare. Elegant, refined bourbon that breaks the 'bourbon is heavy' stereotype. Family recipe dating to 1796.

name: Knob Creek
serverNotes: Full-bodied Kentucky straight bourbon aged a full 9 years from Jim Beam's Knob Creek line. 100 proof (50% ABV). Rich with deep oak, caramel, vanilla, toasted nuts, and barrel char. Bold, robust, high-proof bourbon made in the Pre-Prohibition style with extra aging and higher proof point. Perfect for serious bourbon drinkers who want big flavor, or in spirit-forward cocktails that need a strong backbone. The 100 proof creates intense flavor and warmth. Pairs perfectly with charred ribeye, slow-cooked BBQ brisket, aged cigars, and bourbon chocolate cake. Named after the creek near Abraham Lincoln's childhood home. No shortcuts—aged patiently for exceptional quality.

name: Woodford Reserve "Double Oaked"
serverNotes: Premium Woodford Reserve bourbon aged in two different barrels for double oak character. 90.4 proof. First matured in charred new oak, then finished in heavily toasted, lightly charred barrels. Extra oak aging creates exceptional caramel, dark fruit, chocolate, vanilla, and toasted wood complexity. Rich, smooth, velvety texture. Perfect for sipping neat to appreciate the layered oak influence. Each sip reveals new flavors—this is bourbon as an experience. Pairs beautifully with chocolate torta, crème brûlée, aged cigars, and espresso. From Kentucky's oldest operating distillery (1812) in horse country. Luxury bourbon crafted for special occasions. The double barrel process is labor-intensive but creates unmatched depth.

name: Uncle Nearest "1856"
serverNotes: Premium Tennessee whiskey honoring Nathan 'Nearest' Green, the first known African-American master distiller who taught Jack Daniel. 93 proof. Smooth with caramel, vanilla, charcoal mellowing, and maple sweetness. Uses the Lincoln County Process—charcoal filtering that defines Tennessee whiskey. Rich, important history meets exceptional taste. Nearest Green's descendants are involved in the company today. Perfect neat or on rocks. Pairs beautifully with Tennessee BBQ, Southern soul food, buttermilk fried chicken, and bourbon pecan pie. Award-winning spirit with meaningful story. Every bottle honors Nearest's legacy and contribution to American whiskey. This is history you can taste.

name: Blanton's
serverNotes: Original single-barrel bourbon from Buffalo Trace's premium Blanton's line. 93 proof. Each bottle comes from one exceptional barrel with caramel, honey, bright citrus, spice, and leather notes. Smooth, complex, and highly collectible with iconic horse and jockey stopper (collect all 8 letters!). Highly allocated and hard to find—we're fortunate to have it. Created in 1984 as world's first modern single-barrel bourbon. Perfect for special occasions, celebrations, or bourbon collectors. Barrel number and date printed on label. Pairs exquisitely with dry-aged steak, hand-rolled cigars, and fine dining. Legendary Kentucky bourbon that defined the single-barrel category. Each bottle is truly one-of-a-kind.

name: Angel's Envy
serverNotes: Innovative Kentucky bourbon finished in port wine casks from Angel's Envy distillery. 86.6 proof. Aged 4-6 years in new charred oak, then finished 3-6 months in port barrels. This creates unique sweetness with vanilla, dried fruit, maple, toast, and berry notes. Smooth, approachable, and beautifully unique with stunning bottle design. Perfect for bourbon adventurers who want to explore finishing techniques. The port cask adds wine-like complexity. Pairs wonderfully with tiramisu, chocolate desserts, aged cheese plates, and berry tarts. Premium craft bourbon with innovative twist. Created by legendary master distiller Lincoln Henderson after his retirement. 'Angel's Envy' refers to the whiskey lost to evaporation during aging.

name: WhistlePig "Snout to Tail", 10 Year
serverNotes: Premium 10-year Vermont straight rye from WhistlePig's limited 'Snout to Tail' series. 101 proof. Aged in various casks including American oak, French oak, and toasted barrels. Complex with intense rye spice, caramel, dark fruit, oak, and char. Bold, sophisticated, and limited production—only released in small batches. For serious rye whiskey enthusiasts and collectors. Each batch explores different barrel finishing techniques. Perfect neat to appreciate the craftsmanship. Pairs excellently with wild game meats, venison, strong aged cheeses, and artisan dark chocolate. Award-winning craft whiskey from WhistlePig's innovative farm. The name celebrates using the whole barrel's influence. A true connoisseur's choice.

name: Angel's Envy Triple Oak
serverNotes: Ultra-premium Angel's Envy bourbon aged in three different oak types for unprecedented complexity. 95.6 proof. First aged in new American oak, then finished in Oloroso sherry casks, and finally in Madeira wine casks. This triple finishing creates extraordinary layers with vanilla, caramel, dried fruit, warm spice, and toasted oak. Smooth, luxurious, and released in extremely limited quantities. For serious bourbon collectors and special celebrations only. Each sip reveals new dimensions. Pairs exquisitely with finest dry-aged steaks, premium truffles, aged cigars, and chocolate soufflé. Top-tier craft bourbon innovation that pushes boundaries. The triple cask finishing takes years of planning and patience. This represents the pinnacle of American whiskey craftsmanship.

name: Pendleton, 12 Year
serverNotes: Premium Canadian rye whisky aged a full 12 years, bottled in Oregon. 80 proof. Smooth, approachable character with caramel, vanilla, butterscotch, and subtle spice—less aggressive than Kentucky ryes. Aged in American oak barrels for mellow, rounded flavor. Named after the famous Pendleton Round-Up rodeo. Canadian ryes are known for being smoother and sweeter than American straight ryes. Perfect for whiskey cocktails like Whiskey Sours or Old Fashioneds, or neat for easy sipping. Pairs wonderfully with Kansas City BBQ, grilled tri-tip, apple pie, and caramel desserts. Western-style rye with true rodeo character. Great introduction to rye whiskey for bourbon drinkers.

name: Sazerac
serverNotes: Classic Kentucky straight rye whiskey from the legendary Buffalo Trace Distillery. 90 proof. Bold with intense rye spice, clove, black pepper, and bright citrus. Traditional, flavorful, and unapologetically spicy. This is THE rye for making authentic Sazerac cocktails (named after the drink!) or classic Manhattans. Essential for any cocktail program. The high rye content creates that signature bite cocktail enthusiasts love. Perfect for spirit-forward drinks or adventurous neat sipping. Pairs excellently with charred ribeye, 70% dark chocolate, aged Gruyere, and spiced nuts. From Buffalo Trace's historic campus. Essential rye that every bartender respects—this is what proper rye tastes like.

name: High West
serverNotes: Utah straight rye blend from High West Distillery, the first legal distillery in Utah since 1870. 92 proof. Expertly blended straight ryes featuring bold spice, fresh mint, caramel sweetness, and black pepper kick. Smooth yet assertive—perfect balance. High West specializes in blending different rye whiskeys to create complex, layered profiles. Located at 7,000 feet elevation in Park City's historic buildings. Great for craft cocktails like Rye Old Fashioneds or neat with large ice cube. The mint notes make it surprisingly refreshing. Pairs beautifully with Western BBQ brisket, elk medallions, wild game, and dark chocolate truffles. True Western craft rye excellence from mountain whiskey pioneers. High West revolutionized American rye blending.

name: Knob Creek Small Batch
serverNotes: Full-bodied Kentucky straight rye from Jim Beam's premium Knob Creek line. 100 proof (50% ABV). Rich with intense rye spice, deep oak, caramel, and barrel char. Bold, robust, high-proof rye made in the Pre-Prohibition style when ryes were fuller and more powerful. Perfect for classic cocktails like Manhattans or Boulevardiers that need a strong rye backbone, or for serious rye drinkers who want maximum flavor. The 100 proof creates exceptional intensity and warmth without harshness. Pairs perfectly with bone-in ribeye, Texas BBQ burnt ends, hand-rolled cigars, and bourbon barrel-aged coffee. Premium craft rye aged patiently for depth. Knob Creek doesn't compromise—this is rye at full strength and full flavor.

name: WhistlePig Piggyback, 6 Year
serverNotes: Vermont straight rye whiskey aged 6 years from WhistlePig, America's premier rye whiskey specialist. 96.56 proof. Bold, spicy character with rye grain, fresh mint, caramel, and black pepper. Flavorful yet remarkably smooth from extended aging. 100% rye mash bill creates intense but balanced profile—no corn or other grains diluting the rye character. Perfect for rye-forward cocktails like Sazeracs or Manhattans where the rye needs to shine, or neat for true rye enthusiasts. Aged in new American oak. Pairs excellently with smoked pastrami, applewood-smoked bacon, aged Gruyere, and dark chocolate bark. WhistlePig Farm is Vermont's first whiskey distillery since Prohibition. Craft rye excellence from the farm that made rye cool again.

name: Mad River "Revolution"
serverNotes: Vermont craft straight rye from Mad River Distillers with bold spice, caramel, vanilla, and pepper. 90 proof. Small-batch, locally distilled in Warren, Vermont using traditional methods. Smooth with distinctive character—this is Vermont rye with personality. Mad River is Vermont's first distillery since Prohibition (founded 2013). Each batch is carefully crafted and reflects the Green Mountains terroir. Perfect for rye enthusiasts seeking something unique outside the Kentucky mainstream. Great in cocktails or neat.
