Pairs wonderfully with Vermont BBQ, maple-glazed pork, grilled meats, and dark chocolate. Local Vermont craft excellence from true mountain distillers. Supporting local craft distilling at its finest.

name: Mad River Silver Oak Barrel
serverNotes: Unique Vermont straight rye finished in authentic Silver Oak wine barrels from Napa Valley. 92 proof. Complex with rye spice, red fruit notes, oak tannins, and vanilla sweetness. Innovative barrel-finishing technique creates wine-whiskey hybrid flavors. Limited production—only made when Silver Oak barrels become available. For whiskey adventurers and collectors who appreciate boundary-pushing craft. The wine barrel finish adds remarkable depth and fruit character rarely found in rye. Perfect neat to appreciate the unique profile. Pairs excellently with venison, wild boar, aged Manchego cheese, and dark chocolate truffles. Creative craft distilling from Mad River's experimental program. This is what happens when Vermont meets Napa Valley.

name: Short Path, "Concord Straight Rye"
serverNotes: Massachusetts straight rye whiskey from Short Path Distillery in Everett, just outside Boston. 90 proof. Bold with rye spice, caramel sweetness, fruit notes, and black pepper. Small-batch local craft production. Smooth, flavorful, and distinctively New England in character. Short Path focuses on grain-to-glass production using local ingredients when possible. Great for craft cocktails or neat sipping. Being from Massachusetts gives it unique terroir compared to Kentucky or Vermont ryes. Pairs wonderfully with New England seafood, Boston BBQ, lobster rolls, and apple cider desserts. True New England craft rye from the Boston area. Supporting local distilling in historic whiskey territory—Massachusetts had thriving rye production pre-Prohibition.

name: WhistlePig
serverNotes: Premium Vermont straight rye whiskey aged a full 10 years from WhistlePig. 100 proof (50% ABV). Complex with intense rye spice, caramel, vanilla, oak, and fresh mint. Bold, sophisticated, and award-winning—this is WhistlePig's flagship expression. 100% rye mash bill aged patiently for a decade creates exceptional depth. From America's most renowned rye specialist who pioneered the rye renaissance. Perfect for serious whiskey lovers who want world-class rye. Each bottle represents years of careful aging. Sip neat to appreciate the craftsmanship. Pairs beautifully with dry-aged steak, wild game meats, premium cigars, and dark chocolate. Benchmark craft rye that set new standards for American rye whiskey. This is what 10 years of patience creates.

name: The Boss Hog by WhistlePig, "XI The Juggernaut"
serverNotes: Ultra-premium limited edition rye from WhistlePig's legendary Boss Hog series, 11th edition 'The Juggernaut.' Barrel strength (varies by barrel, typically 108-115 proof), uncut, unfiltered. Extraordinary complexity with rye spice, caramel, dark fruit, oak, and char. Aged 13+ years in American oak, then finished in South American Teakwood casks. Only ~3,000 bottles produced annually worldwide. Collectible ceramic bottle with unique pig design. For serious collectors and once-in-a-lifetime celebrations only. Each bottle is numbered and comes in presentation box. Sip neat—adding water or ice would be sacrilege. Pairs with finest dry-aged beef, white truffles, premium cigars, and single-origin dark chocolate. Pinnacle of craft rye whiskey—this is WhistlePig's masterpiece. Absolute rye perfection.

name: Glenlivet, 12 Year
serverNotes: Classic Speyside single malt aged 12 years from Glenlivet Distillery, founded 1824. 80 proof (40% ABV). Smooth with crisp apple, pear, vanilla, and honey notes. Light, fruity, and exceptionally approachable—this is THE perfect entry to single malt scotch. Aged exclusively in American oak casks for a gentle, sweet character. Great neat to appreciate the delicate fruit, on rocks for easy sipping, or with a splash of water to open it up. The Glenlivet pioneered legal distilling in Scotland and remains the world's best-selling single malt. Pairs beautifully with Scottish smoked salmon, grilled seafood, mild cheeses, and fruit desserts. Gateway scotch that converts bourbon drinkers. From the Livet Valley in the Scottish Highlands.

name: Port Charlotte
serverNotes: Heavily peated Islay single malt from Bruichladdich Distillery's Port Charlotte line. 100 proof (50% ABV). Bold with intense smoke, peat, sea salt, and citrus zest. Powerful, maritime character that screams Islay. Peated to 40 PPM (phenol parts per million)—this is serious peat! Unfiltered and natural color for maximum flavor. For peat lovers and adventurous drinkers ready for the Islay experience. Add a few drops of water to tame the heat and release more complexity. Pairs excellently with smoked mackerel, fresh oysters on the half shell, blue cheese, and aged cheddar. Powerful Islay whisky that defines the island's character. This is Scotland's wild side in a glass.

name: Glenfiddich, 12 Year
serverNotes: Iconic Speyside single malt aged 12 years from Glenfiddich Distillery, established 1887. 80 proof (40% ABV). Smooth with fresh pear, oak, and subtle smoke. Fresh, light, and classic Speyside style. Matured in American bourbon and Spanish sherry casks. The world's most awarded single malt whisky with countless international medals. Family-owned and independently operated for five generations. Great introduction to scotch for whiskey newcomers. Perfect neat, on rocks, or with water. Pairs wonderfully with pan-seared scallops, roasted chicken, mild cheeses, and pear tarts. Reliable, quality choice that never disappoints. The distinctive stag logo is recognized worldwide. From Dufftown in the heart of Speyside.

name: Balvenie Double Wood, 12 Year
serverNotes: Premium Speyside single malt aged 12 years in two woods from Balvenie Distillery. 86 proof (43% ABV). First matured in traditional American oak bourbon barrels, then transferred to European oak sherry casks for additional months. This double maturation creates exceptional richness with honey, vanilla, dried fruit, and warming spice. Smooth, complex, and elegant. Hand-crafted at one of Scotland's last family-owned distilleries. Balvenie still uses traditional floor malting and employs a coppersmith on-site. Perfect neat to appreciate the dual cask influence. Pairs beautifully with crème brûlée, dark chocolate truffles, aged Gouda, and fruit cakes. Sophisticated choice for those who appreciate craftsmanship. From Dufftown, sharing grounds with Glenfiddich.

name: Johnnie Walker Black
serverNotes: Premium blended Scotch whisky with over 40 different whiskies, each aged minimum 12 years. 80 proof (40% ABV). Rich with balanced smoke, fruit, vanilla, and spice. Smooth, complex, and iconic—Johnnie Walker is the world's number one Scotch. Master blender Jim Beveridge uses whiskies from Scotland's four corners: Speyside fruit, Highland flowers, Lowland grass, Islay peat. Perfect for Rob Roys or Blood & Sands cocktails, or neat/rocks. The 'Striding Man' logo has walked across the world since 1820. Pairs excellently with BBQ ribs, grilled steak, aged cheddar, and dark chocolate. World's best-selling premium blend for good reason. Consistent quality batch after batch—a bartender's reliable choice.

name: Lagavulin 16 Year
serverNotes: Legendary heavily peated Islay single malt aged 16 years from Lagavulin Distillery, established 1816. 86 proof (43% ABV). Intense with smoke, peat, sea salt, iodine, and dried fruit. Full-bodied, complex, and powerfully peaty. Peated to 35 PPM then aged for 16 years to create remarkable complexity—the peat mellows but never disappears. For serious peat lovers ready for Islay's finest. This is the whisky that converted many to peat. Add water to unlock hidden sweetness and coastal notes. Pairs exquisitely with Scottish smoked salmon, fresh oysters, blue cheese, and dark chocolate. Iconic Islay whisky featured in Ron Swanson's drink of choice on Parks & Recreation. From the remote south shore of Islay. This is peat perfection.

name: Macallan 12 Year
serverNotes: Premium Speyside single malt aged 12 years exclusively in hand-selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain. 86 proof (43% ABV). Rich with dried fruit, dark chocolate, warm spice, and oak. Full-bodied, luxurious, and prestigious. The Macallan is known as the Rolls-Royce of single malts. They own their own cooperage and season sherry casks for two years before use. Natural color from sherry casks—no additives. Perfect neat or with a drop of water. From the world's most awarded distillery in Craigellachie, Speyside. Pairs beautifully with dry-aged ribeye, 70% dark chocolate, hand-rolled cigars, and Christmas cake. Benchmark luxury scotch that defines excellence. Highland Estates' crown jewel.

name: Oban 14 Year
serverNotes: West Highland single malt aged 14 years from Oban Distillery, one of Scotland's oldest (1794). 86 proof (43% ABV). Balanced with gentle smoke, orange fruit, sea salt, and honey. Medium-bodied, elegant, and complex—Oban bridges the gap between peaty Islay and fruity Speyside. From Scotland's smallest distillery producing one of its most sought-after malts. The maritime location in the port town of Oban gives it unique coastal character. Perfect neat or with water to open up the fruit. Pairs excellently with Scottish langoustines, smoked haddock, aged cheddar, and seafood chowder. Classic Highland style from a distillery in the heart of a working fishing town. Limited production makes this a gem.

name: Johnnie Walker Blue
serverNotes: Ultra-premium luxury blended Scotch from exceedingly rare whiskies, some from distilleries no longer in operation. 80 proof (40% ABV). Exceptionally smooth with honey, delicate smoke, fruit, and vanilla. Complex, elegant, and prestigious—the pinnacle of blended Scotch. Master blender hand-selects only 1 in 10,000 casks for Blue Label. Each bottle is individually numbered and comes in a silk-lined presentation box. Created for special celebrations, milestone moments, and serious collectors. The ultimate gift. Perfect neat or with a single cube—adding water would be unnecessary. Pairs exquisitely with finest cuisine: wagyu beef, lobster thermidor, premium cigars, and luxury chocolates. Icon blend that represents 200 years of blending expertise. This is Johnnie Walker's masterpiece.

name: Macallan 18 Year
serverNotes: Exceptional Speyside single malt aged 18 years exclusively in hand-selected sherry oak casks from Spain. 86 proof (43% ABV). Extraordinary complexity with dried fruit, dark chocolate, warm spice, oak, and fig. Rich, luxurious, and profoundly age-worthy. This is investment-grade scotch—bottles appreciate in value over time. Only released when the whisky reaches perfect maturity. Each drop represents 18 years of patient aging. For ultimate celebrations, milestone anniversaries, and serious collectors only. The Macallan 18 is whisky royalty. Perfect neat in a proper Glencairn glass—this demands respect. Pairs exquisitely with finest dry-aged steaks, white truffles, premium hand-rolled cigars, and chocolate soufflé. Legendary whisky that defines what 18 years of sherry cask aging can achieve. This is Scotland's liquid gold.

name: Nonino Il Moscato
serverNotes: Premium Italian grappa from Moscato grapes. Smooth with floral, grape, honey notes. Elegant, aromatic, refined. Perfect digestif. From legendary Nonino distillery. Pairs with desserts, biscotti, dark chocolate. Traditional Italian after-dinner spirit.

name: Grand Marnier 100
serverNotes: Premium orange liqueur with cognac base from Grand Marnier, created 1880. 100 proof (50% ABV)—significantly bolder than regular Grand Marnier (80 proof). Rich with bitter Haitian orange peel, fine cognac, vanilla, and warming spice. Made by blending cognac with essence of tropical bitter oranges then aged in French oak. The 100-proof version offers more intensity and cognac character. Perfect for powerful cocktails like Cadillac Margaritas or neat for cognac lovers who want orange complexity. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Pairs beautifully with chocolate soufflé, crêpes Suzette, orange desserts, and dark chocolate. French luxury liqueur that elevates any cocktail. More cognac, more orange, more everything.

name: Courvoisier
serverNotes: Classic French VS cognac from Courvoisier, established 1828 by Emmanuel Courvoisier. 80 proof (40% ABV). VS (Very Special) means aged minimum 2 years in French oak. Smooth with stone fruit, oak, vanilla, and caramel notes. Approachable and versatile. Napoleon Bonaparte was reportedly a fan—Courvoisier supplied cognac to the imperial court, earning the title 'The Cognac of Napoleon.' Blend of eaux-de-vie from Grande and Petite Champagne regions. Perfect for cocktails like Sidecars and French Connections or neat sipping. Serve at room temperature in a snifter. Pairs excellently with aged Comté cheese, dark chocolate, premium cigars, and foie gras. Iconic French brandy with imperial heritage. The Napoleon connection is legendary.

name: Grand Marnier
serverNotes: Premium orange liqueur blended with fine cognac, created 1880 by Louis-Alexandre Marnier Lapostolle. 80 proof (40% ABV). Rich with exotic bitter orange essence, aged cognac, Madagascar vanilla, and warming spice. Made by macerating Caribbean bitter orange peels in cognac, then blending with sugar syrup and aging in oak. The distinctive red ribbon and wax seal are instantly recognizable. Essential cocktail ingredient for premium Margaritas (use instead of triple sec), classic Sidecars, and Grand Cosmopolitans. Also excellent neat as digestif or over vanilla ice cream. Serve at room temperature for full flavor. Pairs beautifully with crêpes Suzette (flambéed tableside!), chocolate mousse, crème brûlée, and orange soufflé. French luxury liqueur since 1880—the original cognac-orange blend. Accept no substitutes.

name: Hennessy
serverNotes: World's best-selling cognac from Hennessy, founded 1765 by Irish officer Richard Hennessy. 80 proof (40% ABV). VS (Very Special) aged minimum 2 years. Smooth with stone fruit, oak, vanilla, and warm spice. Bold and iconic with the famous arm-and-axe logo. Blend of over 40 different eaux-de-vie carefully selected by the master blender. Hennessy sells over 50 million bottles annually worldwide—the cognac that introduced the world to the category. Perfect for cocktails like Hennessy & Coke, classic Sidecars, or neat sipping. Serve at room temperature in a snifter or balloon glass. Pairs excellently with aged Gruyère, dark chocolate truffles, premium cigars, and duck confit. Benchmark cognac that set the standard. Prestigious French house for over 250 years. This is cognac royalty.

name: Rémy Martin VSOP
serverNotes: Premium VSOP cognac from Rémy Martin, founded 1724. 80 proof (40% ABV). VSOP (Very Superior Old Pale) aged minimum 4 years, though most eaux-de-vie are much older. Complex with stone fruit, vanilla, oak, warming spice, and wildflower honey. Smooth, elegant, and refined. Made exclusively from Grande and Petite Champagne grapes—the finest growing regions in Cognac. The iconic centaur logo represents the astrological sign of founder Paul-Émile Rémy Martin. Cognac Fine Champagne designation means superior quality. Perfect for special occasions, celebrations, or after-dinner sipping. Serve at room temperature in a tulip-shaped glass to concentrate aromas. Pairs exquisitely with fine dining: foie gras, truffles, dark chocolate soufflé, and hand-rolled cigars. Prestigious French cognac house since 1724. This is what 4+ years of aging achieves—liquid elegance.

name: Croft Reserve Tawny
serverNotes: Tawny port aged in wood barrels from Croft, one of the oldest port houses (founded 1588). 40 proof (20% ABV). Sweet and smooth with caramel, toasted nuts, dried fruit, and vanilla. Mellow with beautiful amber color from extended wood aging. Fortified during fermentation with grape spirits, then aged in oak to develop oxidative character. Perfect as a dessert wine or after-dinner digestif. Serve slightly chilled (60°F) for best results. Pairs wonderfully with roasted almonds, aged Manchego cheese, chocolate torta, and crème brûlée. Classic Portuguese port that offers excellent value for wood-aged style. From the Douro Valley's steep terraced vineyards. Approachable entry to the world of port.

name: Dow's 10 Year
serverNotes: Premium 10-year tawny port from Dow's, a legendary port house established 1798. 40 proof (20% ABV). Rich with caramel, dried apricot, toasted hazelnuts, fig, and milk chocolate. Smooth, complex, and elegant with 10 years of age statement verified by Portuguese authorities. Blend of wines averaging 10 years in seasoned oak casks creates remarkable depth. The extended wood aging creates mellow oxidative character with amber-tawny hue. Serve slightly chilled (60-65°F) to enhance the nutty notes. Pairs beautifully with Stilton blue cheese, roasted pecans, caramel flan, and apple tart. Excellent value aged port that showcases what a decade in barrel achieves. From the historic Symington family port houses. This is what proper tawny port should taste like.

name: Dow's Late Bottled Vintage 2003
serverNotes: Late Bottled Vintage (LBV) port from Dow's, made from exceptional 2003 single harvest. 40 proof (20% ABV). Rich with dark blackberry, bitter chocolate, warming spice, and black pepper. Full-bodied and intense. LBV is aged 4-6 years in barrel before bottling—longer than regular ruby, shorter than vintage. Ready to drink now without decanting (unlike vintage port). Great alternative to expensive vintage port at a fraction of the price. The 2003 was an exceptional year in the Douro. Serve at cool room temperature (60-65°F). Pairs excellently with Roquefort blue cheese, chocolate lava cake, roasted chestnuts, and dark chocolate truffles. Excellent value that delivers vintage-style character. From Dow's historic Quinta do Bomfim estate.

name: Fonseca 20 Year
serverNotes: Exceptional 20-year tawny port from Fonseca, one of Portugal's most prestigious port houses (founded 1815). 40 proof (20% ABV). Extraordinary complexity with burnt caramel, dried figs, toasted walnuts, warm spice, and butterscotch. Smooth, luxurious, and profoundly refined. Average age of 20 years creates incredible depth—this is serious tawny. Blend of wines from multiple vintages aged in small oak casks. The two decades in wood create amber-brick color and nutty oxidative character. Serve lightly chilled (55-60°F) for optimal elegance. Pairs exquisitely with foie gras terrine, Stilton blue cheese, crème brûlée, and almond biscotti. Premium aged port for special occasions. The 20-year represents the sweet spot of aged tawny—mature but still vibrant. This is port house artistry at its peak.

name: Quinta do Noval 2018 Vintage
serverNotes: Premium vintage port from Quinta do Noval's exceptional 2018 harvest. 40 proof (20% ABV). Powerful with concentrated dark cherry, bitter chocolate, exotic spice, black pepper, and fig. Full-bodied, intense, and profoundly age-worthy—can cellar for decades. Made only in declared vintage years (2-3 times per decade) from the finest grapes. Quinta do Noval is a legendary single estate producing world-class ports since 1715. The 2018 vintage was universally declared by all major houses. Should be decanted to separate sediment. Serve at cool room temperature. For special occasions, milestone celebrations, and serious collectors. Pairs magnificently with Roquefort blue cheese, 85% dark chocolate, roasted walnuts, and stilton. Investment-grade port that appreciates in value. This is liquid history—drink or cellar until 2040+. Portuguese port royalty.

name: Amaro dell' Etna
serverNotes: Sicilian amaro from the Mt. Etna volcanic region, one of Italy's most unique terroirs. 60 proof (30% ABV). Bittersweet with indigenous Sicilian herbs, citrus, and distinctive volcanic mineral notes from lava-enriched soil. Refreshing and complex with true terroir character. Made with herbs that grow only on Etna's slopes including wild fennel and Sicilian oranges. Perfect after-dinner digestif served at room temperature or slightly chilled. Aids digestion naturally with bitter herbs. Excellent in Negroni variations or simply over ice. Pairs wonderfully with espresso, cannoli, dark chocolate, and lemon granita. Unique Sicilian herbal liqueur that captures the island's volcanic landscape. This tastes like Sicily itself.

name: Amaro Montenegro
serverNotes: Friendly, approachable Italian amaro from Bologna, created 1885. 46 proof (23% ABV). Bittersweet with 40 botanicals including herbs, bitter orange, and vanilla. Smooth, balanced, and notably less bitter than most amaros—perfect introduction to the category. The secret recipe has been unchanged for over 135 years. 'Montenegro' means 'black mountain' in Italian. Serve at room temperature or over ice with an orange twist. Italy's most beloved amaro for its approachable character. Perfect after-dinner digestif, in Paper Plane cocktails, or added to espresso. Pairs beautifully with panna cotta, tiramisu, biscotti, and after-dinner coffee. Versatile Italian classic that Italians call 'Il Gusto della Vita' (The Taste of Life). Gateway to understanding amaro.

name: Bully Boy Amaro
serverNotes: American craft amaro from Bully Boy Distillers in Boston, established 2011. 60 proof (30% ABV). Bitter-herbal with citrus peel, gentian root, and warming spice notes. Bold, distinctive, and locally made using New England botanicals when possible. American interpretation of Italian tradition with Massachusetts character. Made in small batches with attention to craft. Great for cocktails like Black Manhattans or as after-dinner digestif. Serve at room temperature or over a large ice cube. Pairs excellently with charcuterie boards, aged Vermont cheddar, dark chocolate bark, and roasted nuts. True New England craft amaro that shows American distillers can master Italian traditions. Supporting local Boston craft distilling.

name: Don Ciccio Donna Rasa Rabarbaro Amaro
serverNotes: Rhubarb-based American amaro from Don Ciccio & Figli in Washington DC, founded 2012. 60 proof (30% ABV). Complex with tart rhubarb, bitter herbs, citrus, and warming spice. Bold, artisanal, and innovative. Don Ciccio brings Italian family recipes to America using traditional methods. 'Donna Rasa' means 'woman shaved/razed' referring to the rhubarb root. Unique in the amaro world for its rhubarb focus creating bright tartness. Perfect for cocktails like Paper Planes or as digestif neat. Serve at room temperature or over ice. Pairs excellently with aged cheese, dark chocolate bark, lemon tart, and citrus desserts. Innovative craft amaro that shows American creativity. Supporting DC's craft spirits scene.

name: Campari
serverNotes: Iconic Italian bitter aperitif created 1860 in Milan by Gaspare Campari. 48 proof (24% ABV). Bright crimson red, bittersweet with bitter orange peel, herbs, and aromatic spices. Secret recipe of 68 ingredients known only to Campari family. Essential cocktail ingredient—THE base for Negronis, Americanos, and Boulevardiers. Also served neat as aperitif before meals to stimulate appetite (aperitivo culture). The color was originally from cochineal insects, now synthetic. Serve over ice with orange peel or club soda. One of the world's most iconic spirits—recognized instantly by color and taste. Pairs with orange slices, green olives, Parmigiano-Reggiano, and aperitivo snacks. Italian cocktail culture in a bottle since 1860. No Negroni without Campari.

name: Galliano
serverNotes: Italian herbal liqueur from 30 herbs including vanilla, anise, and Mediterranean botanicals. Created 1896, named after Italian war hero Giuseppe Galliano. 60 proof (30% ABV). Sweet, aromatic, and golden-yellow in color. Packaged in iconic tall conical bottle that stands out behind any bar. Made with neutral alcohol infused with vanilla from three sources (Madagascar, Ceylon, Tahiti) creating rich vanilla character. Perfect for retro cocktails like Harvey Wallbangers and Golden Cadillacs from the 1970s. Also excellent in espresso or over vanilla gelato. Serve at room temperature or gently warmed. Pairs beautifully with panna cotta, fruit tarts, espresso, and vanilla desserts. Classic Italian liqueur with vintage cocktail appeal. The tall bottle tells stories.

name: Strega
serverNotes: Italian herbal liqueur with approximately 70 botanicals from Benevento, created 1860. 80 proof (40% ABV). Sweet with mint, fennel, and saffron creating distinctive yellow color. 'Strega' means 'witch' in Italian—named after Benevento's legendary witches who supposedly met under a walnut tree. The secret recipe is known only to two people. Minimum 6 month aging in oak vats before bottling. Legend says couples who drink Strega together will remain faithful forever. Perfect after-dinner digestif or in Italian cocktails. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Pairs wonderfully with almond biscotti, sfogliatelle pastries, espresso, and Italian desserts. Traditional Italian liqueur steeped in folklore and mystery. The witch's potion in golden form.

name: Fernet Branca
serverNotes: Intensely bitter Italian fernet from Milan, created 1845 by Maria Scala Branca. 78 proof (39% ABV). Bold with menthol mint, bitter herbs, and saffron. Contains 27 botanicals including myrrh, rhubarb, chamomile, and cardamom. Medicinal, polarizing, and cult favorite among bartenders worldwide—it's the bartender's handshake. Argentina consumes 75% of world production—national drink served with Coke. Originally marketed as medicinal tonic and cholera cure. Traditional Italian digestif shot after heavy meals to aid digestion. Serve ice cold as shot or at room temperature to sip. Pairs with rich dishes, aged Parmigiano, espresso, and dark chocolate. Acquired taste but once you love it, you LOVE it. Legendary amaro that separates amateurs from pros. This is extreme bitter.

name: See The Elephant Amaro
serverNotes: American craft amaro with complex herbs, citrus, and warming spice. 56 proof (28% ABV). Balanced bitter-sweet with innovative recipe that respects Italian tradition while adding American creativity. 'See The Elephant' is a 19th century expression meaning to gain worldly experience. Perfect for cocktails like Amaro Sours or as after-dinner digestif. Small-batch craft production using carefully sourced botanicals. Serve at room temperature or over ice. Pairs excellently with aged cheese, Italian charcuterie, dark chocolate, and roasted nuts. Modern American amaro that proves the New World can master Old World traditions. Supporting American craft spirits innovation.

name: Unico Amaro Siciliano
serverNotes: Sicilian amaro with Mediterranean herbs, citrus, and bitter Sicilian orange. 60 proof (30% ABV). Bittersweet, aromatic, and distinctive with true island character. Made with indigenous Sicilian botanicals including wild herbs from the Mediterranean coastline. 'Unico' means 'unique' in Italian—this captures Sicily's sun-soaked terroir. Perfect after-dinner digestif served at room temperature or in Italian cocktails. The bitter orange is from Sicilian chinotto citrus. Pairs wonderfully with grilled swordfish, almond granita, citrus desserts, and espresso. Authentic Sicilian tradition bottled. This is the taste of the Mediterranean sun.

name: Faccia Brutto Amaro
serverNotes: Brooklyn craft amaro honoring Italian-American tradition from Faccia Brutto Spirits. 60 proof (30% ABV). Bitter-herbal with citrus peel, gentian root, and warm spice. Bold, artisanal, and complex. 'Faccia Brutto' means 'ugly face' in Italian—Brooklyn attitude meets Italian heritage. Made in Red Hook, Brooklyn using traditional Italian maceration techniques. Perfect for classic cocktails like Negronis and Paper Planes or as digestif. Serve at room temperature or over ice. Pairs excellently with red-sauce Italian dishes, aged provolone, espresso, and cannoli. Modern craft amaro excellence from Brooklyn's thriving spirits scene. Italian soul, Brooklyn heart.

name: Foro Originale Amaro
serverNotes: Traditional Italian amaro with herbs, bitter roots, and citrus from Foro distillery. 60 proof (30% ABV). Bittersweet, balanced, and classic Italian profile using time-honored recipe. Made with 25+ botanicals including gentian, wormwood, and orange peel. 'Originale' signifies authentic traditional preparation methods. Perfect after-dinner digestif or cocktail base for Italian classics. Serve at room temperature for full flavor. This is what Italian nonnas served after Sunday dinner. Pairs beautifully with Parmigiano-Reggiano, toasted hazelnuts, dark chocolate, and espresso macchiato. Quality Italian amaro that respects tradition. Old-school Italian authenticity in every sip.

name: Nonino Quintessentia Amaro
serverNotes: Premium amaro from the legendary Nonino grappa distillery in Friuli, established 1897. 70 proof (35% ABV). Complex with herbs, grappa base, wildflower honey, and citrus. Smooth, refined, and elegant. Made with Nonino's proprietary ÙE® grape distillate (grappa) instead of neutral spirits—this creates unique character. Uses herbs gathered from Friuli mountains. Winner of multiple international awards. Perfect after-dinner digestif served neat or THE amaro for Paper Plane cocktails (practically invented for this). Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Pairs exquisitely with panna cotta, aged Asiago, espresso, and amaretti cookies. Prestigious Italian amaro from the masters of grappa. This is amaro royalty.

name: Perrine Key Lime Amaro
serverNotes: Unique American amaro featuring Florida Key limes with herbs and bitter citrus. 60 proof (30% ABV). Bright, refreshing, and innovative—nothing like traditional Italian amaros. Made with real Key limes from Florida creating tart, tropical character. Perrine is a neighborhood in Miami known for Key lime production. Perfect for tropical cocktails, tiki drinks, or as palate-cleansing digestif after spicy food. Serve chilled or over crushed ice for maximum refreshment. This reimagines what amaro can be. Pairs excellently with ceviche, Key lime pie, coconut desserts, and Florida stone crab. Creative modern amaro that captures Florida sunshine. Italian tradition meets Miami beaches.

name: ITALIAN Sambuca
serverNotes: Italian coffee cocktail with anise-flavored sambuca. Sweet, licorice notes with espresso. Often served with coffee beans. Perfect digestif for anise lovers. Traditional Italian after-dinner drink. Warming and aromatic.

name: IRISH Jameson's
serverNotes: Classic Irish coffee with Jameson's whiskey, coffee, sugar, cream. Warm, comforting, smooth. Perfect for cold nights or after-dinner treat. Rich whiskey notes with coffee sweetness. Iconic Irish drink.

name: NUTTY IRISH Fratello & Baileys
serverNotes: Nutty twist on Irish coffee with Frangelico hazelnut liqueur and Baileys. Creamy, sweet, nutty. Dessert in a glass. Perfect for those who love nutty, creamy flavors. Indulgent after-dinner treat.

name: FRENCH Orange Liqueur
serverNotes: French-style coffee with orange liqueur (Grand Marnier or Cointreau). Bright citrus notes with coffee. Elegant, aromatic, refined. Perfect for those who love orange-chocolate combination. Sophisticated after-dinner choice.

name: BAILEYS
serverNotes: Classic coffee with Baileys Irish Cream. Smooth, creamy, sweet with vanilla and chocolate notes. Perfect dessert drink. Easy-drinking, crowd-pleasing. Great for those who want something sweet and simple.

name: KAHLUA
serverNotes: Coffee with Kahlúa coffee liqueur. Double coffee flavor - rich, sweet, bold. Perfect for coffee lovers. Great for dessert or after-dinner. Classic coffee liqueur pairing.

name: VIA Fratello & Crème de Cacao
description: Coffee with Frangelico & Crème de Cacao
serverNotes: VIA signature coffee with Frangelico hazelnut liqueur and crème de cacao. Nutty, chocolatey, luxurious. Like a liquid hazelnut chocolate truffle. Perfect dessert replacement. House specialty coffee cocktail.
